Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ozziwanderer
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Walking ( or very cheap $4 aus taxi) from Hong Kong airport express, right next to mid level escalator. Quirky building with on three rooms per floor. Near to some of the best food places cheap and expensive. Staff are faultless. We stayed on level 25 and couldnt hear the streets at all, the bed was lovely we had a fantastic sleep. This is a no frills hotel so dont expect a gym or a pool but its very clean and comfortable with room to move, they do pod coffee thought :) . No breakfast but you are within a short walk of many food choices local, dim sum and everything else. The centre of alot of shopping from high end to cheap ( though nothing like Mong Kok for all the bargains and stalls) I really enjoyed this location and can definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: shinomori
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in the middle of bustling Hong Kong. I stayed here for 3 nights on a stopover on my way home to NZ. A very pleasant stay. The hotel was very modern. Rooms a good size. Bed very comfortable and well furnished elsewhere. Plenty of storage space. Free internet also tea & coffee. Very close to everything. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateSydney
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from four days in Hong Kong staying at this delightful hotel. It is situated on Wellington Street in Central, surrounded by many restaurants, local markets and just a few blocks from the trendy Soho district. Just metres from the mid-level escalators, all areas of Central are very accessible and the ferry terminals (including Star Ferry Pier) are within easy walking distance (around 15 mins). The hotel does not have any restaurant or bar facilities but with so many places to eat this is not necessary. A restaurant a couple of doors away serves a western breakfast (bacon/eggs/omelet) for just a few Australian dollars and, if you prefer, McDonalds is only 5 mins away. Our room (Executive) was very spacious, clean and tastefully decorated and the bathroom was very large. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: venvit
Reviews.Content: We've been there for 2 nights and it has been a remarkable experience! Extremely clean and very modern style hotel, located right in the heart of Hong Kong! Extremely easy to reach from the airport: just get into the airport express, get out at Hong Kong station (end of line station) and then walk for 5 min to the hotel Quite tricky: reception is on the 1st floor and not immediate to understand especially if exhausted by the typical sizzling HK hot! Room was big enough for 2 although not much space left with luggages around. Bathroom quite small. Everything exceptionally clean Everyone was extremely friendly and available to sort anything out for us Definitely a good hotel to consider when planning a trip to HK!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: CalDorset
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really bend over backwards to be both helpful and charming. Nothing was too much trouble for them, be it restaurant recommendations or organizing taxis. The rooms were a good size for Hong Kong, and actually I prefer the room here to those at the Marriott in Pacific Place. The only downside is the lack of facilities. Great location for local food and the Lan Kwai Fong night scene for those that are interested

Reviews.Title: “small and expensive hotel, but good locaion”
Reviews.Author: limwiehan
Reviews.Content: I am staying in this hotel, booked by my friends. We booked 4 rooms all together. Location is very good for whoever want to go near Lan Kwai Fong. Problem is it just beside the market, so expect a lot of rubbish pile up when you look over your rooms window. quite expensive for the the tiny room, but very tidy and well maintained. The reception is friendly, they offered us to upgrade the rooms with additional charge. My friend did, and said it doesn't different much with my room. you got free wifi, with apple pc to use in small lobby. Overall , location is good, but not very enjoyable. I personally feel it very cramp. good only for anybody wan to be near the party scene.

Reviews.Title: “another comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: johnb1501
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Butterfly on Wellington in Central again last weekend. I can confirm my impression that this is a well located gem. I met the manager who offered assistance during my stay and the young conciege went out of his way to organise taxi's and prepare written directions for drivers. very helpful and professional. A great small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Magic”
Reviews.Author: Faberge36
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights as a stopover from London to Auckland and thoroughly enjoyed this small boutique hotel situated right in the heart of Soho, Mid Levels, 50m from the famous escalator, and easy to stroll out at night to all the local bars and restaurants. Rooms excellent, check in and out excellently done, but extremely limited "hotel" facilities other than the room.

Reviews.Title: “Brusque service no breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Goingnutsinchina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the new small boutique hotels popping up on HK Island offering an alternative to the mostly 5 star hotels located on this side of Hong Kong. The rooms and bathrooms are small as usual for HK, but comfortable. The staff are brusque and could be a little friendlier, but again this is common in HK. The hotel is located at the edge of Central and about a 10 minute walk to find breakfast. Compared to other hotels of this type in the area it would be better value and more convenient if the hotel offered a simple breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: vourot
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Butterfly on Wellington in June for 5 nights. The hotel is fairly new, the rooms were small (to be expected in HK) but very clean. Just take note that some of the bathrooms require that you be up close and personal with your room mate / partner!! The staff were helpful, friendly and young but somewhat inexperienced. Check in took awhile and there was an interesting issue that came up with my Amex card during my stay. Above all else, this is a fabulous location and offers great value. You are in the heart of Central/Soho and can easily access all the bars, restaurants and shopping by foot. Although the hotel does not have a restaurant, you will find a variety of restaurants on Wellington Street to suit all tastes and budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, perfect location,just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Serena C
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this perfect boutique hotel in Hong Kong. It's in a wonderful location and the staff are helpful , friendly , young and charming. This hotel is full of young, chic, on the ball people ,both working here and as guests. They knew this was my second visit and I was treated amazingly. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: Classybabe99
Reviews.Content: Chose this as our replacement hotel because its sister hotel--Butterfly on Victoria wasn't opened to the public yet. Overall a nice hotel. Small room, but who spends that much time in the hotel anyway? A short walk from the Airport Express Hong Kong station if you don't have too much luggage, otherwise a cheap taxi ride. Very close to Lan Kwai Fong and Soho District. MTR station is also a short walk away. Only complaint is a slow draining sink that occasionally emitted some bad odors. Bed is firm, but pillows are too soft for my liking. Free Nespresso coffee in the mornings at the reception desk if you aren't lucky enough to land a room with a Nespresso machine already.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great”
Reviews.Author: 0Tentacles0
Reviews.Content: 4 Nights, 3 of us stayed in the executive room with free wifi, average per night is around $1930 HKD. I would consider the rates to be reasonable for a hotel on Hong kong Island. Comparable hotels at that point in time will be Kowloon Shangri La on Mody road however I chose this hotel because it was 1 of my friend's first time in HK and my friend wanted somewhere near H&M. This hotel definitely has a superb location; To start with, it is very near to the airport express central, by cab it is probably 10-15 mins away depending on the traffic. On wellington street, this hotel is just walking distance to the famous 'Yung Kee' roast goose restaurant, the 'Lan Fong Yuen' famous milk tea cafeteria, old school dim sum place 'Lin Heung Tea House', 'Tsui Wah' 24 hrs restaurant. Roadside stalls also surround the hotel. Food is never a problem staying here. It is very convenient for u to walk around and shop as well, it has a few brands there which most people will like. Transportation wise, cabs are pretty economical, if budget is on your mind, MTR Central station is within walking distance from the hotel 7-10 mins. If u are thinking of nightlife, pubs, clubs and drinks u are in luck, Lan Kwai Fong the famous spot for Hong Kong's nightlife is just 7-10 mins walk away, popular club like Magnum club is also in the vicinity and it is a pretty neat one. Room is nice and spacious very unlike the typical HK type of small and cramp rooms. It is clean, clean sheets and towels. The bed is comfortable enough for 3 persons sleeping in it. Bathroom is pretty decent as well. Hardly any view from the 9th floor though, just street facing. As for it's service, I wouldn't fault it too much as they are prompt, efficient and professional but I find something lacking, perhaps they are not too friendly, I do find most of the staff a bit cold. They just lack the WOW factor, if they were to be slightly better I guess this review would have gotten a 5/5. Only thing I hated about this hotel is the street beside it, Graham Street, as it is a wet market in the morning it gets very dirty in the middle of night with a lot of rubbish stack up by the curbside near the hotel entrance, waiting for the rubbish truck to pick them up. The other thing to note will be, the actual hotel's reception is 1 floor up when u enter through the door, there are 2 lifts, use them and go 1 floor up for check in. Concluding this, hotel is in a very very good area, very accessible, near to almost everything, rooms are nice and decent, service is ok. Price is reasonable. Definitely a good choice, especially when u are visiting Hong Kong for the 1st time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Condie84
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on the way home from OZ and found this to be a perfect location for exploring this amazing city. Hotel is on a great street with plenty of places to eat. Its very near the escalators which is handy for getting your bearings and a few flights up was a group of bars where we had couple of crazy nights out. Room was quite small but very clean and modern with a lovely bathroom. We had a view of the wet market from our window which was interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location value for money”
Reviews.Author: auntieadriene
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd trip here with my husband. We had such a great experience during our last visit that there was no other option for us this time. And it did not disappoint. Rooms are well appointed. Well decorated, clean , well maintained. Nice cosy toilet. In general a well designed, thought out room. Location is excellent , just 5 min walk from central mtr station , just off the mid levels escalators, surrounded by amazing food choices. Also, we like that we can walk to IFC via over passes to check in and take the airport express for our flight. Very convenient. A special mention to the Receptionist staff here who speak excellent English and are very polite, helpful and knowledgeable. Always a pleasure. No doubt we will be back here next time we are in hk.

Reviews.Title: “The location is very good”
Reviews.Author: SimonDallas
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is really remarkable. One tips for hotel guest, 蓮香樓 Lin Heung Tea House is only about 100 yard west of this hotel. This is one of the best tradition dim sim resturant. You could find a lot of YouTube video about this resturant. The price is very reasonable. Please go there early, bring a news paper and enjoy breakfast tea (早茶）at this resturant 。

Reviews.Title: “Average place”
Reviews.Author: Th3Trav3ller
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the heart of the city, this is huge plus. Pictures on the website looked ok and I already knew other hotels from butterfly brand, price was really good so I booked one night stay at butterfly on wellington. Not sure if it was just a bad day for them but few things did not quite worked out for me. First - reception staff spent like 15 minutes on the phone so I had to wait for the checkin. Second - there was a coffee machine in the room but no coffee. problem has been rectified although it took 15 mins. Third - some coffee spots on the table, place was not properly cleaned. Most important - internet connection just didnt work at my room. I had to go downstairs to the lobby which was already quite crowded but I just needed to send few mails. Like I said, maybe it was just a bad day, I will give them another chance if the price is good. The location is just too good....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TheDirkster
Reviews.Content: Other than small rooms, this place is great - clean, modern, comfortable, responsive staff, wifi that works. Best part is the great location near Soho, Hollywood Rd, lots of great restaurants and bars, easy walk to Central metro. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “All round great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJX
Reviews.Content: This is a well priced (a big plus for Hong Kong) and centrally located hotel. Rooms are nicely furnished and comfortable. It's not far from the MTR too. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It is clean and very cheap”
Reviews.Author: Joko P
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Clean, fine and really worth the money. Free wifi makes us work while on vacation at night. Enjoy it

Reviews.Title: “Quiet nest in the center of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: carolannt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from home in LA without a clue about the location but I liked the name. When I arrived, I was a bit concerned by the activity in the area, that seemed to be The spot fot HK night life. But as soon as I walked in, I forgot about everything. I felt safe and at home. The staff is incredibly nice, the decoration tasteful, I had a quiet room and was even surprise by the size. I moved in with three suitcases for a three-week trip and I could fit almost all my clothes and shoes in the closet! The next day I found out that there is a vegetarian restaurant in the same street, called Mana, almost all my meetings were around that busy street.Pure Fitness is 5 minutes away. It is the perfect location indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stopover in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Hanwelldiana
Reviews.Content: Very easy to walk with bags from the nearest MRT - took about 10 mins. Room very good with lovely comfortable bed at a great rate. Street outside bustling and interesting within easy reach of all central places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a quick visit”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeBizTravel
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Butterfly on Morrison, but the brand has expanded across Hong Kong and, as I had a quick visit I chose the Butterfly on Wellington. The Butterfly brand are no-frills hotels so there are no facilities, not even breakfast. However you get a good price and a clean tastefully decorated room and an efficient check-in and check-out service. The Butterfly on Wellington held the promise of this brand very well indeed, and I had a delightful stay there. The location is second to none - next to the escalators to mid-levels with all the bars and nightlife. Despite the outside bustle however, the room was a peaceful haven with a nice designer theme, a power shower, good aircon and a tea/coffee maker. Most of all it was clean and the bed was comfortable. If you just want a great room for the night a few steps from hundreds of restaurants, the MTR (underground train) stations and shopping, and you can live without a gym, buffet breakfast, fancy-dress doormen or servile pampering, I highly recommend this place. And by the way, you can walk to the hotel from the Airport Express station if you arrive from the airport using this. You'll need to study the map, but you don't need a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: 91Chris
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Perfect for somewhere conveniently close to Central (walking distance). Also walking distance to Hong Kong station if you want to take MTR to the airport (and don't have too much luggage). Rooms modern and clean. Has no restaurant so no breakfast, but that is fine by me as I prefer to eat out anyway. Staff friendly and helpful. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “True Gem located in the heart of HK (Central District)!”
Reviews.Author: ejk2003
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for 3 nights, and had a wonderful stay! The Central District is where you want to be for its proximity to the Star Ferry and the ferry to Macau, both of which we utilized. The underground is close by as well, which allowed us to visit the Big Buddha, New Territories, and Stanley. I would highly recommend staying on a high floor. The rooms are clean and spacious for Asia. The service was so attentive and wonderful, such that the hotel quickly became our home away from home in HK. I would highly recommend b/c you will adore the staff who will make sure that your stay is every bit as pleasant as you want it to be when you're traveling. The positive reviews here are solid. You will not regret staying here should you need a couple days in HK and a reliable base from which to explore the surrounding parts. You WILL be treated like an old friend, and who doesn't need friends in far-flung places? Enjoy -- we certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location on HK Island”
Reviews.Author: jeanoo
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at this property and I have to say it matched my expectations. Just a 5 min walk from all the great food and shopping at Queens Road Central (H&M, Kau Kee beef noodles, Yung Kee), just 1 min to mid-levels escalators to hit Soho area and 10 mins walk to Central station. It was a very convenient location where you can easily hop back into the hotel for a bit of R&R or to put down your purchases. Hotel room was small but adequate. WIFI was free which was extremely useful for a quick check of emails or the Internet. There were lots of cafes, eateries just below the hotel in case you didn't want to walk too far. Below the hotel also had stalls selling fruits and foodstuff. A nice way to see the local way of life. I would stay there again for a short weekend trip to be near wherever I need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Azdaddie
Reviews.Content: Easy ten-minute walk from the airport express, just off central escalators. Great restaurants and nightlife all around. Room small by US standards, but very comfortable and well appointed. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect example of a "just-works" of hotel, in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: ExoB
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Butterfly on Wellington, and can only recommend the hotel. The reception worked without a hassle, fulfilling all requests without a problem. The single room was smallish but totally adequate. The room was clean and nicely decorated. WIfi worked without any problems in all areas of the hotel we tried. The best part of the hotel was the location. The bar area starts just about there but does not bother the stay either. The main station is very close, easily walkable even with luggage, it is very easy to reach all areas of the city. For a local style of breakfast try Lin Heung Tea House about one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Really funky, reasonably priced boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DouglasHauser
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights in mid-May. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. It just feels really nice – the aircon works well, the room was very clean and beautifully designed. Good attention to detail – down to the scent in reception – very nice. Service was efficient and friendly. Only down side was the knock on the door before 9am and accompanying shout of ‘LAUNDRY!!!’. Not cool. Top tips: Book in advance on the hotel website for good deals. Put a ‘Do not disturb’ sign on your door!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in fab central location !”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetCambridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on route to visiting our son and fiance in Oz . It had been suggested to us by a friends son who lives in HK ,and it did not disappoint one bit . Granted if you are looking for a room with a view ,don't stay here ,but if you like really BIG beds and clean friendly asian style hotel then go book . We stayed in one of the larger rooms ,bathroom was amazing with a massive wet room ,lovely toiletries ,soft plush towels /bathrobes etc . The bed was easily the biggest I have seen ,and soo comfortable !!There is no restaurant but just moments away from hotel is a huge shopping mall with loads of places for breakfast /dinner .There are also loads of eateries on your doorstep ,we didn't miss eating in hotel at all .All the staff are warm ,welcoming and friendly ,I have no hesitation in recommending this wonderful hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Top Location for Biz/Pleasure. Great Value for HK. Clean, Modern”
Reviews.Author: samthefish06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Butterfly on Wellington for a business trip and stayed for 2 nights in March. Previously I had stayed only at larger chains, like Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Conrad, thinking of large-chain reliability and quality. I gave the Butterfly a try as I had heard good things about smaller boutique hotels like them in HK. I was impressed with my stay from start to finish. To start, the room rates are very reasonable for HK standards. And given the cleanliness of the hotel, the beautiful decor, the staff service, and great location to work and pleasure, I realized it was even more of a bargain. Check-in was efficient and smooth, I was upgraded to the top floor Deluxe room. Although it had 2 twin beds, I didn't mind. The room was larger, and quiet as it was on the top floor. Room was clean and had amenities such as complimentary water, hot water boiler, and fridge. At the end of my stay, they kept my luggage for me through the day until I boarded my midnight flight, which was very helpful and convenient. The one detraction is while there are air conditioning services for cooling, there is no central heating. Thus if you're in HK during a very cold period, you might want to bring extra layers even in the room. All in all I would highly recommend the Butterfly on Wellington, whether for business or holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Orang_County_greg
Reviews.Content: Small rooms and not a lot in the way of amenities(it's a small boutique hotel) but clean comfy rooms and an awesome location. For this place I'd have a 'spend limit' in place but wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Also, the rooms are HK small so not a lot of room for 'stuff', these rooms are best for individuals or light packing couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: klmklm
Reviews.Content: This no frills boutique hotel is a great bargain for a week in Hong Kong. It is on Wellington street one block from the escalator and a short walk from central - which for a tourist is a prime location. There is a small lobby with friendly and helpful staff. Free WiFi is a huge bonus, as well as two computers in the lobby. The rooms are small but well appointed. Very hard beds are the only drawback, but this is not unique in China. Nice bathrooms. There is not a concierge or doorman, but the place has a nice sense of style. For the price - it is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Some things should be left to be imagination - but excellent location in down town Central.”
Reviews.Author: Jil33n
Reviews.Content: As a result of the property boom, and being a popular tourist and business destination, HK is known for high density living in very small quarters. As we knew that we would be  spending more time discovering the city then we would be stuck inside a hotel, when deciding on a hotel we focused more on the location.  Butterfly on Wellington St. In the Central district scored well on this point being located only 10 min walk to IFC mall, and the HK Express Train stop & MTR. The hotel does not offer breakfast or room service (there is no need as there is a large range of restaurants and cafes for all budgets as soon as you step out of the hotel).  The  rooms are well kept and basic though the design could be improved - if you didn't know your partner well before, you will after a stay at Butterfly with it's see through toilet and showers - transparent for all sorts of sights (smells and sounds!)

Reviews.Title: “designed by 80's hippy”
Reviews.Author: PARISS10
Reviews.Content: Its a reasonable mid range BUDGET style hotel for the price. Hk hotels are sooo expensive. It seems to be always full.There is no breakfast or food available. There is no one to help with your bags. I had to stand in the pouring rain for 45 mins to get a cab to the train to go to China. There is no shelter outside the front of the hotel. Reception would not order a taxi for me. The bathrooms are awful - the washbasin and vanity are some old ragrolled effect resin or something. It doesn't look too hygienic. Dark brown tiles and an overhead shower that refuses to work, no matter how many times you call for a technician, you end up using the hand held.Time they upgraded their bathrooms out of the 80's. The bathroom smelt really bad. I did complain. I think they splashed a bit of deodoriser around, but its a drains smell. Ick.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the Action, Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: RockyMountainCFO
Reviews.Content: I came for a business conference and brought my 14 year old son, so I wanted to be in the heart of the action, where we could get to the MTR, the Airport Train and also the waterfront. I also wanted to be right in a neighborhood where we could be integrated into the heartbeat of HK and this area is bursting with vendors, HK stores and outdoors restaurants. The room was nicely appointed and up to a high standard with nicely appointed marble showers, comfortable beds and excellent wireless for iPad and laptops....it is a HK room so it tended to be smaller that our typical American upscale chains. Nevertheless, the hosts gave us fine service and everything was within 4 blocks. I would stay here again, although I would try to get a better rate. We got the limo service from the airport which was good value and a good way to start the trip, getting delivered right to the front door. I recommend the Flying Pan breakfast joint just two blocks away for great way to start off your day.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest room”
Reviews.Author: yofobubu
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews on TA and I was very disappointed. The hotel might be easy to locate in the day time. However, we spent close to an hour from the time we exited the MTR. The check-in was quick. The room was tidy. However, it was very small. We paid a lot of money for such a tiny room. The same night, I searched for rates at a 4-star hotel and it was cheaper than what I paid for this. We checked-out next morning. The plus point is that it is located in the heart of HK Central and you can easily get around anywhere. Give it a miss if you're traveling with kids and book a hotel with a bigger room. The prices are rather high for a shoe-box.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Bryce P
Reviews.Content: It was in a nice central location room was nice and staff where fantastic. We got the limo service from the airport which was good value and a good way to start the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie888Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at BOW and it remains my favourite boutique hotel. Its location is superb as you are smack bang in the middle of Central and know you are in Hong Kong. The rooms are very small but I acclimatised after a few days. Staff is well trained and happy to help - Adam went out of his way to help me find a taxi and brief the driver. Na Trang Vietnamese restaurant is very close and very good but Habibs - the food was lousy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, very pleasant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rengephil
Reviews.Content: A breath of fresh air in the central district! Nice, comfy rooms, good shower, adequate lighting in room (I would add an extra light in the bathroom at the mirror) very good wifi, a fridge, clean...I truly enjoyed this hotel on the bright side of HK. The decor is is pleasant to the eye without being to much. A small desk to work or read. Staff at reception were efficient and friendly. The location is very good, close to restaurants and close to banks and offices for work. Having stayed at the Luxe Manor and Sheraton in HK, I would not hesitate to go back to the Butterfly.

Reviews.Title: “Design comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: Truffie
Reviews.Content: Welcome to the best of Hong Kong! I chose this hotel for the proximity to Hollywood road antique shops. This was a good move. Little did I know how great it was for getting to the Midlevels and how easy it was to escalate myself to restaurants and shops all over the hillside. The recommendations of the staff for food were perfect.Actually,the service was perfect all round. Design was taken into account everywhere one looked. Beautiful rooms,and at night I opened up the windows and saw the pulsatiions of lights all over the neighboring buildings. Quite a sight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee A
Reviews.Content: I traveled to HK for business as part of an Asia wide trip. Having stayed at premium hotelsnthrought the stay, I have to say that the Butterfly on Wellington is by far the best of the hotelsninstayed in. Great location Fantastic staff Boutique style Would throughly recommend for business andnleisure travel

Reviews.Title: “Great Base to Explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Don B
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hong Kong and the Butterfly on Wellington was a punt and it turned out to be the perfect place for us to explore the city. It is a few blocks or an Escalator ride away from the Airport Express train. And, it's very close to the bars, restaurants, shops and nightlife of Soho and Lan Kwai Fong. The rooms are smallish but well kept and up to date and the staff are great. The ferry terminal for trips to Macau and the little gem we found Lamma Island is not far nor is the MTR which opens up the rest of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in central!!”
Reviews.Author: Wilkar
Reviews.Content: Great location!!! All you need is just 5 to 10 minutes away (at most), all transporation systems, food and drinks, corner stores, marketplace, there are even two laundry places :) Friendly and helpful staffs, spotless clean and spacious room ( in HK standard it is very spacious, been to same price range hotel and room size is just a third of it), free Wi-Fi, free bottle waters, spacious shower cubicle. The only down side is that they don't offer free early check-in, unlike many of the North American hotels which has that flexibility. Our flight arrived 8 am and hotel check-in is at 4 pm, so at the end we pay one extra day of room fee for our 8 days of staying. We will stay at this hotel again for our next visit to HK, the location is unbeatable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: froufrouBkk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February 2012 for 2 nights. The location was amazing. Right in the heart of Hong Kong, just one block from the travelator. The rooms were modern, had a nice design, even if small. The staff was helpful. Bathroom was nice. We found that the location was so great, we were able to take breaks back in our room without having to go out of our way too much. Highly recommend this hotel for the value, cleanliness and location in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at the Butterfly on Wellington and worthy of Excellent reviews”
Reviews.Author: Seanyw
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel on trip advisor as the LKF hotel recommended by office was too expensive for my business allowance. I wasn't disappointed with my choice. When checking in they upgraded me to an executive room without asking. I also got free wifi/ internet which is always most welcome. The internet worked well and was super fast. The hotel is in a great location, they offer great service, great rooms with fantastic views of the city, good shower/bathroom and most important a good night's sleep. What more could you ask for?. Well the only addition would be some kind of breakfast. I recently stayed in a hotel in Australia where they had the idea of Brekfast on the go for business people. This consisted of a small pack of cereal, milk, a breakfast pastry, fruit and a fruit juice. All for around 15 Austrailian dollars. I think an addition this that would add a finishing touch to this hotel. There is plenty to eat and drink around the hotel and it is all very cheap!. The streets feel very safe late at night. Will certainly be staying there again next time I am in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in the center of Central HK”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFoggII
Reviews.Content: As most every review here notes, this hotel is optimally located with quick and easy access to transport, shopping, dining and area businesses. In fact if you arrive by air and take the Airport Express into HK Island, you can easily roll your light weight luggage from the station to the hotel [though a taxi is only about 25HK$]. The deluxe room was stylish and spacious by HK standards - we've paid plenty more for smaller rooms. Bathroom was also large with ample sized shower. We were on the 10th floor with windows facing two directions - one down Wellington the other facing construction... not great views but we experienced no problems with noise. Hotel team was friendly and helpful. As noted there are no rec/health facilities if that's a must on your list - but the savings is reflected in the competitive room rates offered. If you're visiting from the mainland China and in need of any Apple products, the HK store is a ~15 min walk over to the IFC mall and the prices saving can be significant. Dining and drink options are plentiful both in Central and up into SOHO. One suggestion is lunch at "The Square" in the nearby Exchange Building 2 - small but outstanding dim sum lunch menu, as well as additional excellent main menu dishes on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on our last three short visits to Hong Kong and have not found any reason to complain yet! Great location near to the mid levels elevator and only a short walk to Hong Kong Station for the airport express if you are travelling light. No breakfast but on Hong Kong Island you are hardly stuck for a variety of options! Free WiFi internet in the ample sized room. Staff have always been friendly and helpful and we will continue to stay here when we visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value to stay this hotel both for personal and biz trip”
Reviews.Author: YukiTakeuchi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Executive Room on 22nd floor given an offer to upgrade as I was staying here more than 1 week. Room is spacious, clean and also very quiet despite of the location - as this hotel is situated close to SOHO and street markets, it's a bit nosy from morning till night. Easy to access to Central, SOHO, MTR, and Ferry terminals. All is walkable. In neighborhood, you'll find local restaurants - there's a good congee restaurant and a noodle shop nearby, or if going up by mid level escalator, you'll find lots of international restaurants and bars where are always busy with foreigners. Hotel receptionists are always helpful - on weekend we asked to borrow cutlery, wine glasses, wine opener and wine cooler, then they tried to get them for us even though they do no have such things since they do not have a restaurant or cafe... Suppose they went to borrow these from neighbor restaurants.... Wine cooler was full of ices...We are grateful for their outstanding services. Overall, I recommend this hotel - but would be better to book as earliest as possible since it seems this hotel is fully booked always...

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: ali T
Reviews.Content: Love the location, its close to everything, 5 minutes walk to get to metro station, Soho area, restaurants. Rooms are small and clean, but amenities are adequate for short stay. Not much facilities in the hotel though, it's a good choice if you just need a room in central area at a reasonable price. Reception service is excellent, very efficient and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Value stay in the heart of Lan Kwai Fong”
Reviews.Author: YMBL68
Reviews.Content: We have tried many hotels in Hong Kong, but time & again, we always come back to this one! So far, we have stayed here for more then 3 times. The rooms are clean & in fact quite spacieous by Hong Kong standard. It is so convenient located! Right outside, it is the busy Wellington St, Lan Kwai Fong, Soho, Mid-level. Walked for 5-10 mins, you can be at the IFC & the Star Ferry Pier.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality, Boutique atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Declan S
Reviews.Content: Central location, right in the heart of Hong Kong Island the Butterfly offers exquisite, if small rooms that are extremely comfortable, absolutely spotlessly clean with friendly staff without the cost of an international brand or conference facilities (that most of us are not using!). We would definitely recommend this to you. Arriving after a long flight? then pre-book their limousine service; it makes the final leg of your journey perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: TokyoWineLover
Reviews.Content: Great location-walking distance to Central/Soho/Sheung Wan. As a result, was able to meet most people within 10 minutes. Room is small but tidy and the housekeeping staff were quite kind in providing extra blankets and a heater as it was quite cold when I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper alternative in Central HK”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 nights at the start of March as it is one of the cheaper alternatives in a quite expensive market in Central HK. The location of this property is excellent if you want to explore HK island. It is about a 10 minute walk from the Hong Kong Airport Express station which is linked to the IFC mall and the Central MTR station. The elevated walkway is about a small block from the hotel so it's very accessible. The reception to the hotel is actually on the 1st floor and not on ground which is slightly unusual but there is certainly a classy boutique feel once you enter the reception area. Check-in was painless and I was upgraded to a executive room on the 25th floor after my preference of a single king bed in a normal room had run out. The hotel is only a small building with probably only 3-4 rooms on each floor. My room was quite nice, nice solid wooden touches and refined feel. The space was more than adequate with a full desk, free wifi, ipod dock and LCD TV. There is an empty bar fridge which is great to store water which you need in a humid climate as HK. There was a Nespresso machine but strangely though the room doesn't come with an iron which you need to request front desk to bring up when required. There is a large shower with good hot water pressure and decent toiletries supplied. I was happy with my three night stay and the staff were very welcoming and friendly and English was not a problem. The hotel does not have any restaurants or bars but food is everywhere within the vicinity and there are plenty of watering holes around and also Lan Kwai Fong is a mere 10 minute walk. Choose this hotel if you want to be in the thick of the action in Central and don't want to spend an arm and a leg !

Reviews.Title: “Central Location; Comfortable; Small Rooms; No Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: aharol
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for a HK holiday. Very close to central HK, close to MTR station, lots of eating options nearby, mid-level escalators two blocks away, lkf / soho nearby. Rooms are small (as I believe is quite natural for HK) but comfortable. Would have been great if breakfast was served but not a bog issue given all the eating places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of rip-off when paying by credit card !”
Reviews.Author: Jushi Y
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the hotel, cleanness, Wifi etc. However, when checking out, if you pay with a non-Hong Kong Dollar credit card one is presented with the choice of paying in Hong Kong Dollar or one's home-currency. The exchange rate on the later is 4.35% higher than market rate - but that information is hidden away to be easily overlooked. Quite a rip-off, which leaves a bad taste.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: wac36
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights. It was a good location close to markets and shopping. Very close to Central Escalators. We also walked to the Tram to Victoria Peak. Lots of restaurants along the escalator route. Just ride along and choose your restaurant/bar for the evening. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Penny was great with helping us during our stay there. Pics submitted by other travelers are very accurate and I did not feel the need to submit my own. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and convienence location from Van BC”
Reviews.Author: echan565
Reviews.Content: Room is very clean, 10mins walk to Tram & Airport express. Bussing during the daytime very quiet in the evening, lots of places to eat on Wellington St. I used to lived around this area when I was younger many many years ago. The only negative coment is the see through washroom sliding door in the room has limited privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Fault It”
Reviews.Author: OzzyGirlWiltshire
Reviews.Content: I was pleased in so many ways that I chose this hotel! Having now visited Hong Kong, HK Island is the best location to stay and this, the best-located hotel to stay in. Although not budget by normal standards, it is by Hong Kong standards, so another good reason to choose it. It's in a local (very authentic, interesting) area, located close to all the main sites on the Island and only a short walk via the shopping centre from the station area. (Warning: When you first arrive at the station from the airport, you can only access the area via the shopping centre and its covered walkways as there is no foot access across the main road at ground level. Once you've got your bearings it only takes 5mins and is very straightforward - you just need to persevere the first time!). The staff on reception are welcoming and will store your bags on day of arrival/departure (if required), while the hotel itself is clean, modern and very comfortable. We were very happy throughout our stay and the comfy bed most welcome after hours of walking around HK and its surrounding islands. Other reviewers have mentioned strange smells etc, but we never had this problem. I loved everything about this hotel and it will always be my hotel of choice whenever I'm lucky enough to be in Hong Kong!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice on a budget”
Reviews.Author: FlyingGirlLB
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places for which I would choose 3.5 out of 5 if it were an option. When we were looking at Hong Kong hotels it seemed impossible to find something that was neither 5-star luxury or a hostel, and the Butterfly chain was one of the only options in our price range. The hotel was very small: tiny room, tiny lobby, tight hallways, but we expected this. We liked the decor and little touches of character, and everything was clean and seemingly new. We also loved the staff. It was clear that they were trying really hard to please guests and start the hotel off with happy customers. I really appreciated the free wi-fi in the lobby. The location is fun - right in the heart of chinese markets and close to main shopping streets and great restaurants. One thing I would recommend is that the hotel partners with a nearby gym to give guests free access!

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of SoHo - nice!”
Reviews.Author: CynWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed right in the heart of SoHo, so close to the amazingness of Stanley Markets and the mid levels. The hotel is a nice little spot, checkin swift, staff courteous. I chose the room upgrade to the Executive class, a king size bed and Nespresso machine the added bonus. The room is nice sized, well laid out and the bathroom ample, though a shower only. The lighting in the bathroom is shocking - way too dark for putting on a bit of lippy in the am... Mini fridge in room, but not a pre stocked mini bar. This is no drama as you're surrounded by great restaurants plus convenience stores. Free wifi is fast and easy to connect. Overall, a good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Comp N
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 6 times over the past year, usually for 5-6 days at a time. The hotel is extremely well located for both business and tourism. A good quality free Internet feed is very useful for business. The rooms are a good size for Hong Kong. Since the hotel is relatively new, the furniture and decor is in great condition.

Reviews.Title: “great central location”
Reviews.Author: johnb1501
Reviews.Content: after 25 years traveling to HK i have found the best, reasonably priced, centrally located, small hotel. Ideal for the business guy who just needs to crash in a clean place between meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and all around good vibes”
Reviews.Author: lotusland_traveler
Reviews.Content: Since I didn't know much about HK prior to getting there, I chose this based on price. I'm really glad that I did. This hotel was clean, has friendly staff, and is in the best location I can imagine. Very close to the centre with big buildings, close to metro and train to airport, 2 blocks from mid-levels escalator, and hundreds of places to eat. I would definitely stay there again. Only suggestion, lobby/reception area is not very welcoming as it is small and feels cramped. But, hey, I didn't hang out there and everything else was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to know they're improved!”
Reviews.Author: bongkeh
Reviews.Content: well, the last time I stay here, I swear to God Im not coming back here anymore. but when my company asked me central or tsim tsat sui? I'd go central and the budget is only can cover BOW. when I reach, of course they're none there, there is no porter boy anymore. then I reach the lobby, check in was fast, they give me upgrade which is really appreciated, remembering the ordinary room is really small. they improved and they're great now. the room was clean, bath amenities refilled everyday, free water bottled is refilled. well, this is a great improvement since the last time I went to BOW the best about this hotel is location and its central. its for those who already grown up and professional. not like causeway bay and so on. for the price they're offering, comparing many other hotels in central area? BOW will be my choice if I dont have much budget. the mtr is really close if you know the path, just go to the small alley infront, 3 junction then you find the big road, just go straight then you find mtr. food is everywhere, at the 1st junction of the alley, theres a small store selling herbal drink, thats my favorite even long time before I stay here with BOW. there is plenty of good food here and good hidden underground boutique around central. and yes, I will be staying here again and promote this hotel if they're keep being nice like this.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTravellers
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, right next to the lively Graham Street Market and just a few minutes walk from the Central-Mid levels escalators which took us straight to the Airport Express train as well as local subway and ferry port. Breakfast isn't included but there are loads of options in the nearby vicinity. Wi-fi is fast and free, unlike some of the larger hotel chains. The staff were always friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean with a contemporary decor. Although the room was small as we expected it would be, there was plenty of cupboard space, large flat screen TV, a fridge, tea and coffee facilities and an in-room safe and the bed was very comfortable. There are just two points that were slightly annoying. First, the airconditioning vent couldn't be switched off so there was a continual fan noise. Secondly, the bathroom. Even though it had a fabulous rain shower and nice products, I just didn't like the sliding glass doors which didn't give you any privacy. They were frosted but had a clear patterned section and didn't quite meet when closed together so you were always aware of 'noise' which could certainly be a bit too much information for some people! I'm not a prudish person but do like a little bit of personal space when it comes to the loo. Apart from that though, everything else was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the oriental style deco.”
Reviews.Author: ebisuyi
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel can only mean 1 thing --small! Location's good even though it sits within the domain of the wet market. Summer will be scary considering the bugs and rats that live around. Neither brekkie nor gym room, and the lift-waiting game is annoying esp when u have to ride with the trash bin or service cart. If you want to waste yourself at LAN Kwan Fong 24/7 that'll be another story. But, for money and comfort sake, get yourself a nice suite (38sqf) with harbor view at Metropark near Causeway for 2/3 of the price seems to be a much better deal I reckon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in Central!”
Reviews.Author: TheEuge
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Butterfly on Wellington on Jan 12-14, 2012. My wife and I haven't checked out at the time of this writing but the hotel is already a sure hit! Hotel building is the typical small building on narrow and crowded Wellington St. Hotel Reception area is small but very cozy on 1F. Checked-in in less than 10 mins! No one else was around. Hallways are narrow but not necessarily a let down! When we got to the room we were amazed! It may be only 16 sq.m. but it's definitely 16 sq.m. of asian elegance! The room door, headboard, side tables, closet door, writing table and ref cabinet were in elegant varnished wood finish with weaved mat accents. Nice asian touch! The wall colors were mixed well with the asian feel. Everything just clicked. Bed was very comfortable and the sheets and pillowcases were smooth on the skin. Bathroom was small, but definitely does not feel it as the color and design made it feel good. TV, ref, safe, free wifi and writing desk rounds out the amenities. I couldn't imagine our 3 kids fitting into this room with us, but I would happily spend for another room as we got this room for only Php 8,000+ per night. Security is reassuring as both entrance doors and elevators require card access. This hotel is within walking distance of Lan Kwai Fong clubs and the Yung Kee restaurant along Wellington St., definitely a plus since we planned only to go out on the town on this trip. Will surely stay again in this hotel! I strongly recommend it to anyone, it's money well spent. Thanks butterfly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence of service”
Reviews.Author: Cui X
Reviews.Content: Effective and professional services, nice and kind attitude, convenient location are worthy to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; reasonably priced;”
Reviews.Author: wendy9145
Reviews.Content: Deluxe room 1502 was v e r y tiny but well laid out. No view. There is good working space, a tea/coffee cabinet and wardrobe. The wardrobe has a shelf under the hanging space and so this means there is insufficient length to hang dresses or slacks which will crush up on the shelf. There is a shower not a bath and the door to the shower does not open all the way as it hits the toilet. This gives you an idea of how each mm of the room is used. That said - the room was clean (although the carpet would benefit from a shampoo). Service from reception was prompt and requests for extra towels, iron etc were met with alacrity. On the key criteria of location and price, this hotel delivers very well as indicated by other reviewers, so I won't repeat information already provided. I would definitely stay here again particularly for a shorter stay 2-5 days. I was here for 11 days and found the space a little confining after a while. Also because of the limited rails in the bathroom there was nowhere to hang hand done laundry and this was a touch inconvenient. On the odd night, noise from adjacent rooms could be heard through the walls. Free wifi was great and trouble free.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LaCez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 1 night there on Nov 2011, taking the advantage of his business trip. We booked a standard room but got an upgrade, so we had the suite. Spectacular! The room was huge (considering that we were in the heart of HK!), clean, conditioned and fully equipped. The toilet was clean and the shower box was comfortable, with high-quality toiletries. We did not have breakfast there, so I can't tell about food quality. Receptionists were kind and pretty fast in checking in/out. The hotel is conveniently located on Wellington Str, in the heart of HK, close to Central subway station/Airport Expressway, bars, restaurants, shopping malls and business centres. Prices are not that expensive, considering the average costs in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: muertemaria
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a good size, free wifi and right next to the wet Market. This was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Denver_CoEdwink
Reviews.Content: This Hotel had a great location and their rates were cheap compared to other spots in the Central district. The Room was clean and the bathroom was great. Huge Shower and lots of space....surprising. The Hotel is all about the cartridge coffee though, so if it's not your thing watch out. I forgot the brand name, but it's the prepackaged single serving brew machine thingys.... The area around this Hotel was our favorite around Hong Kong. Close to the MRT, the long escalator and many great restaurants and shops. You can get here from the MRT without a cab. If you go to Hong Kong, don't trip out when the cabby hits you with a "boot" free. Boot is what british peeps call a cars trunk. FYI The Vietnamese Restaurant up the street was the best spot we ate at during the long weekend. If you're living somewhere in Asia and need a dose of Christmas, visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: meljl90
Reviews.Content: Good value typical sized rooms for Hong Kong, centrally located very helpful staff and free wi-fi. The Butterfly hits the spot on all the above we enjoyed a great two night stay on route to New Zealand. We would love to spend more time in Hong Kong and the Butterfly is a great base

Reviews.Title: “Tall and slender”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: A convenient stop over for a couple of nights breaking the journey between from London to Sydney. Not too far from the hill escalator system and a short taxi ride from Hong Kong Airport Station terminus.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Hong Kong Central District”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: When I travel, I love to immerse myself in the culture. This hotel is a standard boutique hotel in the heart of the central district. You would be hard pressed to find a better location. The rooms are clean, very comfortable with a nice bathroom and large, rainfall shower. The hotel employees are exemplary in the approach to service. They are knowledgeable to the area and make check-out a breeze. To be specific, upon check out, they hail a taxi and call you when its ready to leave. The hotel is 15 min walk from the airport express station, 10 mins from bars/nightclubs, and markets all-around. Some of the world's best dining options are in walking distance. For the business traveler, I highly recommend this hotel. Might not be the right fit for young families (eg infants/toddlers), bc/ the rooms are small and you're right in the heart of a fast paced residential district. GREAT FOR THE BUSINESS TRAVELER! Please keep in mind that there is no gym, nor restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Location !”
Reviews.Author: Jambc1234
Reviews.Content: Sometimes, location is everything. This being my second time to HK, I decided to stay in the heart of the action on HK island. There are very few hotels in the central/soho location, this being the most reasoniably priced, yet still pricy for size. But, not for the excellent location. Near the midlevel esculators, shopping, nightlife (happy hour is between appox. 3pm-9pm, everywhere near the hotel). I only slept and showered in the room. A good thing to note about the Midlevel esculators ( or travelators as they are called there) They go down from 6am to 10am and go up between 10am and midnight. They were after all built for the rich people's maids ... not tourists lol. I suggest taking a cab to the hotel if you are at all unfamiliar with the area. You can walk to the hotel though the mall connected to the train terminal via skyways until you get to the midlevel esculators... or you can save the time, effort and pay about $4.00 US for the ten min. taxi ride to the hotel. Taxi's are cheap !! The hotel does not have breakfast but, why bother with the choices around the hotel. A small bakery across the street, kitty corner to the left, cheap and good. Or the famous 'flying pan' for an english/american breakfast. Take the esculators up and you will spot the sign for the flying pan on the left, you're a traveler you'll figure out how to get there once spotted better than I can explain. I had a regular room, it was small, but well appointed. The bathroom with the sliding 'glass doors' are strange, and could break it for some if you're not comfortable going to the bathroom in front of whom you're traveling with --- Nightlife around the room is abundant -- but, not sketchy. Could not hear anything in the room, and only 8 floors up. It is upscale, and very expensive for most people of HK. A cheap happy hour drink will cost your around $5, double or triple that after 8-9pm when most people start to come out. Which is still a good price for such a metropolitan city. Sunday and Monday you will find lots of food and drink deals. Almost everywhere a 10% service charge is added, if not you should add. However a large carlsberg beer in the can at the 7/11 will cost you about $1, there are three with in a block of the hotel. The area right around the hotel at night, can be a little dark, but a block over is the soho area, In the morning it comes to life as a food market. So, don't be shocked. Also to note, an empty fridge, tea pot w/tea, coffee, hair dryer, free internet, and electric converter came in the room.

Reviews.Title: “tranquility in the middle of pure asia”
Reviews.Author: aboffi
Reviews.Content: Butterfly on Wellington was a pleasant surprise, you would never imagine to find such a well designed and furnished hotel in the middle of the crowded roads and markets of Central Hong Kong. Location is excellent: few minutes from the tram/metro lines, right in the SOHO/KFL district, many bars and restaurants close by. During the daytime the roads below are jammed with merchants selling everything from veggy to electronics. At night you just need to turn the corner to find yourself on the stairway to hell! :) Hotel is new and very clean. We had a beautiful angel room on the fourth floor facing the remains of a historic HGK building on one side and an old ladies balcony/open kitchen on the other! it was crazy we loved it was like being in a postcard. Service is fine. Yes there is no breakfast but if you ask reception they will send you to a nice bakery 50m down the road that makes great coffee and pastries. Also there is a Mc Cafe literally down the hill on Queens Rd. Yes maybe you can get more/better amenities in other hotels down in Causeway Bay area but you would miss out on the pleasure of not needing a taxi during your entire stay :)

Reviews.Title: “real boutique in heart of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: nathanwaks
Reviews.Content: The Central district on the Hong Kong Island remains the real heart of this great metropolis. Butterfly on Wellington is pretty much in the centre of Central, so a great location for restaurants, night life etc. Hotel itself has surprisingly good taste in furnishings (unlike many in this part of the world), and has a real boutique feel. All the necessary amenities for a 4 star- rooms a little small, but very well appointed. We had a good deal at a hard to book time, so some value consciousness here too. No pool or fitness centre-Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would go back”
Reviews.Author: MoonsterUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on HK island right by the escalators. 5-10 mins easy walk to IFC mall and star ferries, 10 mins walk to peak tram. Beautiful rooms, clean, quiet with very comfy beds. Hot shower. Tea/coffee provided. Free wifi in room.. Staff very helpful. Highly recommend fit price and I would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect but has its prize”
Reviews.Author: Razzor9000
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location near hong kong central station. the staff were very nice and the rooms were wonderful. they were even too good because i stayed too long in the hotel than go sightseeing hong kong. It was rather expensive but its worth the money. In the lobby they have free internet acces. I can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HellsBells83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend. Its a fantastic hotel... the staff were friendly and the rooms are beautifully decorated. The location is excellent - short walking distance to the airport express station, central MTR and the ferries. Literally outside the door in the morning is a local market, a great place to pick up some fruit for breakfast, its close to the bars in the evening (go for happy hour as drinks are expensive in HK) and some tasty cheap, local restaurants. We stayed on the 9th floor, which was very quiet. We arrived at 9am after an 11 hour flight, and were able to leave our bags so we could explore until check in at 2pm. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel in Central Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: badmire
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! For those who had some negative comments about it...you are in Hong Kong! All hotels are rather small and all have small elevators that serve 30+ floors. Also be prepared to walk a bit in Hong Kong...it is ok just be ready for it :) This hotel was great! The room was plenty big for myself and a companion (but I was alone). There was wifi at the hotel. The bed was very comfy and it was in a good location. My room did not have a view...but that is ok...I was not paying $300 plus US dollars for a room with a view at other hotels. If you fly into town...take the express line to the Hong Kong station...walk south through the big IFC mall and meander your way south and a bit west. print out a map before you go and you can find it. However expect to have a 15-20 min walk and if you have tons of luggage you may want to get a cab. I traveled rather light so it was not problem. head south on Graham street (up a hill and it looks more like an alley than a street with tons of food shops and stuff) and it takes you to Wellington, turn right and there the hotel is on your left. See my pics I took of my room and see for yourself. There are tons of restraunts and shopping around...and Lan Kwai Fang is also nearby...5 min walk..

Reviews.Title: “Geat choice for a couple travelling for leasure”
Reviews.Author: LaowaiFromShanghai
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband love going to hk once or twice a year. We tried some high end hotels and some more affordable locations. This hotel is definitely worth staying in. The location in superb. It's tiny, but really lovely. Will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfiend_30
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, modern and clean. Free Wifi is a nice touch too. Service is very cordial and the price is pretty reasonable for HK. The hotel is very close to Lan Kwai Fong area and to the IFC mall. Grab the airport express train for HK$100 and get off at central. Its a very simple 10 - 15 minute walk from there. Very close to the action but also not too close so the immediate surroundings are not loud. Rooms are on the smaller side, but still reasonable. If you arrive after midnight I suspect you may have a problem getting into the hotel so make sure to coordinate with them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jo-dr
Reviews.Content: The hotel calls itself butique, but it must be as compared to other Hong Kong hotels, as no hotel in Europe with so many floors and rooms would call itself this. Still, despite its many floors and rooms, the hotel is cosy and has a boutique feel, as there is no lobby area or other big commun spaces, so you don’t bump into other people very often. The European-sized room was nice and clean, no smell. We had free Wi-Fi in the room, and not only in the lobby as the hotel’s own web page suggests. The location is very good for all the main sights on the Hong Kong side – short walk to SoHo, Tram peak, Star ferry, and airport express station. You don’t need a taxi, you can walk to the hotel along the Elevated walkway (only bear in mind that there is no lift down to street level, so you’d have to carry your luggage down some 20-30 steps at the end. There is a street marked just by the hotel, so the area might not look nice, especially in the evening after the marked closes, but before they clean up the mess, but it’s just appearances, as the neighboorhood feels totally safe (just as the rest of the city). They don’t serve breakfast at the hotell, but there is a small café selling coffee, sandwiches and muffins a few hundred meters up along the same street (direction towards Tram peak).

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly Succeeds on Wellington!”
Reviews.Author: TheSk8Guru
Reviews.Content: I've traveled on business to China for 15 years, usually 4 trips per year. Early on, I fell in love with Hong Kong, and always spend at least 1 day / night on each trip to enjoy this beautiful city. I have always stayed on the Kowloon side. Lately, at the Butterfly on Pratt in Tsim Sha Tsui. On this trip in late October, I stayed 2 nights at Butterfly on Wellington. What a pleasure! I had never spent ANY time in Central, and in particular in the area near Butterfly on Wellington. So getting to the hotel by taxi from the Airport Express Central Station seemed twisted in knots. Driving down Wellington heading to the hotel, frankly I was worried I picked the wrong hotel in a dicey location.... I could not have been more wrong! Butterfly puts their hotels in the center of the greatest neighborhoods - and once we walked around, discovered that this is the place to BE in Hong Kong. Everything is in walking distance or escalator trips. So many restaurants! Pubs! Shopping! Malls! Seriously good fun for 2 days. The Hotel is set up a little differently from the Butterfly on Pratt. The door takes you to an elevator, and reception is on the 2nd floor. Check in was easy and quick. The "lobby" was quiet, with rich wood decor and comfortable seating. We rushed up to our room, with 2 single beds for my work companion and myself. The room was fresh, clean, perfect. Not that small, I expected much tighter quarters. I have a huge luggage case, and was able to open it, stow it, and keep it out of the way. Bedding was world class, and the beds were softer than most in HK. The bathroom was typical of the Butterfly Chain. Great detail to materials, sinks, faucets and showers. I was pleased to see that all Butterfly hotels use the same shampoo - a great citrus scent - I actually looked forward to that scent, after 2 weeks travelling in China hotels with industrial strength "complimentary" shampoos. Finally, the view from our window looked back up Wellington street towards the esclators. The city view was awesome from our windows. The room was quiet, no noise from the streets nor the elevator. One last treat...walk up Wellington at night and look back to the Hotel. You will see huge, colorful Butterflys floating up the exterior walls of the hotel - a neat trick with LED lighting. I highly recommend the Butterfly on Wellington, and will make this my new home base for some R&R at the end of business trips.

Reviews.Title: “excellent good and great front desk service!”
Reviews.Author: lynnypl
Reviews.Content: i walk in around 9.30pm and needed a room to rest but limited resources. They offer me a great price and i stayed in this prefect hotel. room is great with fantastic amenities. large bathroom and large room. front desk was great! they provided good information for attraction! even early morning they provided free flow fresh coffee at lobby. they provided free access wifi at lobby. if u did not have ipad to connect to wifi, u can use imac at lobby. great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: flyingace007
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Hong Kong and I did a lot of research trying to find a good hotel in a convenient location. Finally we have decided to stay at the Butterfly on Wellington Street located on Hong Kong Island. It was the best choice we could have possibly made!!!This hotel opened up less than a year ago so everything was brand new and clean. The room including bathroom was very nicely decorated, large (for Hong Kong), clean and quiet, with a view of surrounding skyscrapers. The staff was very friendly, pleasant and helpful. And the location was perfect! It was just minutes from all the stores on one side and all the great restaurants in Soho on the other. Local food market was taking place right next to the hotel every day. The IFC Shopping Mall and Star Ferry pier were approx. 10 min. walking. We are definitely staying here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ok with a deal, otherwise overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sanduquin
Reviews.Content: Room size and decoration are good, and bathroom had a contemporary design. Got an executive room on a deal with first night half-price, but two nights at full price would not have been worth it. Good location, no breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location in central Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: mikediliberto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week during a work-holiday trip and we had a great time. The Butterfly on Wellington is located close to just about everything, thanks in no small part to its proximity to the mid-central level escalators. Central is the place to be in Hong Kong, so an amazing amount and diversity of shops, markets, and restaurants are nearby. We've stayed here a few times, in both the standard rooms as well as the executive rooms. Both are nice, but the executive rooms are noticeably larger. Otherwise the amenities are similar, a nice bed, LCD tv, and a small fridge and kettle. The bathroom does smell a bit musty, however this is Hong Kong, water and humidity are somewhat inescapable; just close the door and no drama. The lobby has a few computers, free papers, and coffee (via a nespresso machine) in the morning. For those of you desiring a more substantial breakfast (available 24 hours a day, mind you), you can't go wrong with The Flying Pan, just off of Hollywood rd. To get there, head back towards the skyway, but walk up the street below it. When you get to Hollywood rd, the skyway takes a sharp turn to the right. Continue up the street straight and The Flying Pan will be about 50 meters up on the right. On weekends there will be a wait, for good reason. Getting there: As mentioned, the hotel is very close to the mid central level escalators. To get there from the train, exit the metro at central, and take the escalators up into the IFC mall. Exit into the skyway towards the post office, and make your first right past the post office onto the walkway that takes you past the backside of the IFC. From there, walk to the end, until the walkway bears left. Follow the walkway through the enclosed art gallery space, and onto the first of the mid level escalators. One more escalator and you will see a sign indicating an exit onto Wellington st. Head down the stairs, turn left onto Wellington, and the hotel will be a block or so down on your left. Around: While walking to the hotel from the skyway, you'll notice quite a few restaurants, especially some nice ones on your left. Thai, Egyption, Indian, and lots of others. In addition, a block past the hotel, on the left, is a great little sidewalk bar that we found ourselves at a few times. Just past that is the 7-11 shop, should you just want to retire back to the room with a few cold ones. Other things: The doorman is on duty 24 hours to help with taxis or directions. The lobby is actually on the second floor, so head past the doorman to the elevators and stop on two to check in. The lobby staff are great, strong english skills and very accomodating. We have another trip to Hong Kong coming up soon, and you can bet we will be at the Butterfly on Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Price & location”
Reviews.Author: Outcider
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights during a trip to Hong Kong to visit friends and sightsee. Butterfly is close enough to the never-ending escalator, Central train station, and the ferries that you pretty much have the city & surrounding islands at your feet. The decor is a pleasantly modern upscale Chinese style, lots of red and gold; the bathrooms are lovely Euro style with large showers, and the front desk folks are good at English and know the neighborhood well. Take their advice! There are several what my friend calls "cat alleys" nearby that have very inexpensive but nice souvenirs, including jewelry and household items. It's close to a great Dim Sum place, and right down the street from the 24 hour Tsui Wah, as well as many other good places, so you will eat well for cheap. If you start to miss western fare, there's a place called Classified, up on Hollywood Road. That's also a good place to go in case everything else is closed for a holiday. Butterfly is also a block above the financial district so I had good access to my ATM for our trips to Lantau Island/Big Buddha, Ocean Park, and Ten Thousand Buddha Road. If you like pricier bargain shopping, IFC mall is at the end of the neverending escalator, two blocks away. Wellington Street like much of Hong Kong, is quite run down and dirty, but you'll get over it. It's safe pretty much day and night, there's lots to do, and it's so convenient. The downside of Butterfly is that when you get in before check in they will tell you to upgrade if you want a room-- not a terrible thing; but also there are some plumbing ventilation issues that cause the rooms to smell a bit musty if you don't keep your bathroom door shut at all times. They'll change your room if you complain, but I can't say it makes a lot of difference till you figure out the bathroom is the source.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the heart of actions and food!”
Reviews.Author: LTJ71
Reviews.Content: It is a real gem, minutes away from major restaurant like Yeung Kee, the famous roast goose place, Lieung Hieang which is literally minutes away. Walking distance to Lan Kuai Fongafale, SOHO, and nearest MTR is central!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kaytraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and enjoyed every bit of it. Definitely go for the EXECUTIVE room (430sq) that's on almost the top floor (it's the one that's pictured on their website under that title), if it's available during your travel dates. The room is -huge-, with tons of space and cabinets, a huge work desk, glass windows all around, amenities (like complementary water bottles every day), a really stylish bathroom, a huge sofa - and it feels fantastic to wakeup in one of the tallest buildings in the area! There was a mix-up with the rooms: we asked for a non-smoking room, they offered a (smaller) smoking room at first, but when we "complained" about it, they upgraded us to the executive room for FREE without blinking an eye! Superb service!!! The location's great, and when you don't feel like walking or taking an underground, just get a taxi, they're super cheap in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: decon11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this week and it was great. Located in Central, near MTR, LKF, Soho area and right down the street from my favorite Dumpling House. It was Golden Week in China and rates were pushed up due to heavy number of travelers from China. Found a good price for Butterfly and it worked out great. Five minutes to every area listed above. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: WorldX1
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location: fly to HKG, take the airport express train and you can literally walk to the hotel a few blocks away via the escalators. One important thing to note, this is a boutique hotel and I would suggest contacting the hotel directly to confirm the room type. It may not be clear to you or them what your reserved if done online and if the hotel is booked, it could lead to problems. It almost happened in my case. Pretty awesome to wake up to the view of one of the tallest buildings in the world from my window.

Reviews.Title: “Good location as long as you dont need a taxi on check-out!”
Reviews.Author: Cantabflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier in 2011 in transit to New Zealand with my wife and found the style and atmosphere of the hotel well up to the expectations I had gained from previous reviews. However, I would question some of the hype around this hotel as there are many alternative places that I have stayed in the area that offer better all round value - the room price quoted was far from "budget" priced and nothing is especially spectacular about the place. The rooms are certainly not large but quite adequate on the basis that Hong Kong is somewhere to explore and enjoy rather than to spend time in a hotel - the glass enclosed toilet and shower was rather unexpected and might be an issue for some visitors who prefer the privacy of an enclosed room but was no problem for us (in this, the design was similar to that adopted in my room when I stayed at L'Hotel Nina - see my review).
