Coffee facilities in the reception area was rather a gimmick and we ignored it in favour of finding out own brekkie outside. Location is the key winner of this hotel, as it is literally a stones throw to all the sights of Central. We got a taxi from Hong Kong Airport Express train station on the way to the hotel to check-in, but on our check-out in the early evening for a night flight to AKL, we found that there were simply none to be had. We even lugged our luggage over to a nearby road that was busier, but still no luck. The concierge could have been much more proactive and helpful here, but pretty much left us to get on with it. We eventually had to carry our luggage all the way to the in-town check-in desks of HK Airport Ecxpress Station, across the streets and walkways of Central. Not fun, but at least it was not summer heat or pouring tropical rain, but this issue alone, and the poor attitude of the hotel staff to help us, would dissuade me from staying here again unless I was on a very light luggage trip such as a short business trip, or where I could work in an office and have the taxi organised by colleagues from there.

Reviews.Title: “good spot”
Reviews.Author: n-opp-1e
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 night. its a great little hotel. service good. unfortunately no breakfast there is a nice place down the road were you can have breakfast. we arrived at the hotel at 8am unfortunately we had to wait till 12. which I can understand but didnt appreciate especially after a long flight all you want to do is have a nice lay down. 4 hrs waiting is pretty long. its nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Loved this boutique hotel. Would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: Natalie090
Reviews.Content: The Butterfly On Wellington has an excellent location and is close to shopping and restaurants in Central and Lan Kwai Fong. The lobby is one floor up from ground level and has a modern Asian design, which was very nice. I also loved the scent in the lobby. The room itself was spacious - only 3 rooms per floor ensures privacy. We had a king room on a high floor, which I understand was an upgrade. The lighting in the bathroom was somewhat dim, but otherwise the facilities were superb - complete amenities, toiletries and laundry kit, iron, slippers, robes, espresso maker. The hotel did not provide in-room wifi. Wired internet was available, but not useful for those with iPhones, iPads, etc. There were two Mac desktops in the lobby for guest use, and were almost always available, but it was a minor inconvenience not having wifi in the room. Also, I inquired upon check-out if rooms were available for our return to HK at a later date and the rates were nearly double. The hotel staff didn't seem too concerned with attracting repeat business, and weren't able to offer a better rate - their rate was even higher than the internet rate.

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly on Wellington - very good”
Reviews.Author: lurcher500
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Butterfly on Wellington twice in the past year. At the outset, I have to say that this hotel just has rooms and then a reception area (with computers) - it doesn't offer breakfast or have a leisure suite or other facilities. But it is a very clean, very modern lovely boutique hotel with an enviable location on Hong Kong Island. We stayed in executive rooms to get extra space and found the rooms to be extremely comfortable. From an aesthetic point of view, the rooms are great, the beds are lovely, the tv is flatscreen, there's a nespresso machine in every room as well as kettle and tea, a fridge, safe, lots of closet space and the bathrooms are equally lovely - with big showers, earthenware sinks, very modern. The staff are brilliant, very helpful, showed me how to use the Nespresso machine, fixed our safe when we accidentally locked ourselves out of it, and willing to do housekeeping whatever the hour. Best of all about this hotel is the location. It's 2 mins walk from the famous Mid Levels Escalator, it's 5 mins from the IFC and the ferry piers, it's 5 mins from famous Lan Kwai Fong and all the bars and action and right in the heart of the shopping district. Likewise loads of lovely restaurants and cafes nearby so plenty of places to get breakfast and eat throughout the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone doing business in Hong Kong or just staying a few days to do some shopping or sightseeing, if you don't need a pool or a gym, then this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Central”
Reviews.Author: Bean007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times and found it very good value for Central. The location of the hotel is excellent with all of Central an easy walk. The rooms are spacious and well appointed and you get free internet connection. I found the hallways dirty but the rooms were always clean enough. Be warned to put on a Do Not Disturb sign in the mornings if you don't need to get out and about before 9am as the cleaning lady will knock every morning until you answer the door! There is no food available at the hotel but plenty of decent restaurants nearby (especially if you go local). The staff were willing but not very efficient. This is by far the best value option I have ever found in Central.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a bubbly area of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Tacande
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. It is a clean, classy, well appointed hotel. Only drawback is that we got a room in floor 2 so didnt get any views despite I asked specially for a higher room when I booked, a while ago. So the views are pretty ugly, but being so closed to the lobby, we have good wifi signal. Anyway, this is Hong Kong. In a different city you might pay less for this kind of room, but here, the deal is quite good. For me, thea bed and linen is one of the most comfortable I ever had in a hotel, perfect to help you deal with jetlag.

Reviews.Title: “A saviour in an otherwise expensive city”
Reviews.Author: barve
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had lived in HK for 3 years and this was our first trip back after over a year. Knowing how expensive hotels were in the city, we were quite nervous about where we were going to stay and didn't want to end up in a nondescript hotel somewhere in Kowloon. When I discovered the Butterfly group of hotels on this site, I jumped at the thought of having a hotel option that had good reviews and was centrally located. The group has 3 properties in HK, with two of them located on HK Island and one in Tsim Tsa Tsui. We opted for the property on Wellington Road in the heart of the mid-levels where we had lived before. I loved the hotel. It turned out to be located next to a restaurant we used to frequent called Habibi and we almost missed the entrance as we walked down the street. Like apartment buildings in HK, the entrance is narrow and you have to take an elevator up to the lobby, which is minimally yet tastefully done up. Check-in was smooth and we were soon riding up the elevator to our room. The room and bathroom is small - but then this is HK. However they were done up really well and were very comfortable. The hotel is truly functional in its services - so no breakfast or lunch is served here. But you only need to step out and head up to Soho in the mid-levels to enjoy a vast variety of delightful restaurants. The room rates were really affordable, given both the city and the location in the city, which was a pleasant surprise. We intend on going back to HK and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, really???”
Reviews.Author: eolopinion
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during my last business trip to Hong Kong. I tough I would check-in in a good boutique hotel in line with the boutique market in the city. Wrong guess!!! The rooms are very small - 15m2, bad TV reception, no Wi-Fi, no water pressure in the shower and the hot and cold water are not stable! Plus the bedside alarm clock was not reset before I check in and therefore ringed at 6am.......... As for the hotel itself, there is No breakfast, No restaurant, No gym...basically no lifestyle! Plus their internet prices make no sense! Rates go from 800 to 2500 HKD within the same week!!! For 800 HKD it might be a good deal but for the price I paid - 1800HKD...no!

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: Chus_Gijon
Reviews.Content: Just a few meters from Soho, the location is great to discover Hong Kong Island and enjoy some drinks at night. The rooms are tiny, but comfortable. The problem is the bathroom, annoying not only for its Lilliputlian size, but also for its glass door, rendering sharing the room suitable only for exhibitionists. Internet in the rooms is cabled, not WIFI, so it is useless for smartphone or IPad users.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMucci
Reviews.Content: Excellent room - good size, fantastic shower, impressive view, very clean. Location also good. Service was a little bit lacking though and we had problems with the toilet not flushing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but could use some improvements.”
Reviews.Author: suprchick77
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic! It was a bit confusing to find when we first arrived at the train station, but it was easy to get around once we knew how to get there. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and bars, and the view from our room on the 20th floor was excellent. When we arrived at the hotel, we were informed that our room type was fully booked, so we were given an upgrade to a larger room on a higher floor. When we got off the elevator, we were immediately met with a strong musty smell, which also carried into our room. The room itself was large, with a wrap-around sofa and a lot of cupboard space. However, there were numerous large, dark stains on the carpet (some of them were more than a foot around), so along with the musty smell, it didn't feel quite as clean as it would've felt had the carpet been in better shape. Otherwise, the room and amenities (including the fancy espresso-like machine) were great, and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. It was a bit strange having to sit in the lobby to use the wifi, but it was better than having no wifi at all. I would recommend this hotel mostly for its location and price, along with the great view from the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel at Central”
Reviews.Author: 勤 思
Reviews.Content: My partner & I often travel to Hong Kong for work & usually stays at Kowloon Hotel when we are there. Since it is our 1st trip away for Christmas together, we decided to stay at Hong Kong side this time round. We are pretty impressed with this small boutique hotel situated in the crowded & busy Central district though we had alittle difficulty looking for it initially. We stayed at a deluxe room & it is reasonably big for a Hong Kong hotel room size. The bathroom is pretty small though. The location is wonderful especially if you love good food. Yung Kee is just a 5 mins walk away. There is also the famous Tai Cheong bakery, opposite Tai Cheong Bakery, there is Law Kee porridge joint & the list just keeps going.. :)) The hotel is newly opened for business when we went there in Dec 2010. When I went back for work in Feb 2011, the place seems all done up. I would love to go back there soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Lookingaround
Reviews.Content: Couldn't get over the central Soho location. We were hanging with friends and everything they suggested was within a few minutes walking distance. Lan Kwai Fong is a short walk from here too. The Metro is a 5 minute walk, which makes this hotel great. Very ecclectic decor. The street that its on is very smelly as it has a street market, but otherwise.. great hotel.. great no nonsense service and we had a nice little corner room with views of the Financial centre, so can't complain. Also this is on the airport express line with no transfers. And you can check in your bags and get your boarding pass at Hong Kong station. Super convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Central HK - location is great”
Reviews.Author: Lazla
Reviews.Content: Went to Hong Kong for the weekend and needed to be relatively close to the mid-levels/central Hong Kong area. This hotel is great both for location and for the overall quality of the hotel. The room size was relatively large (for HK standards) having attractive modern decor in the room. The bathroom/shower was all glass (very nice) giving the room a feeling of a upper end hotel. Extra's such Free internet and ipod/iphone docking station were good. Conceirge was helpful in getting taxi's when needed. Cost was surprisingly low for HK for a good hotel in great location. Can not comment on the restaurant as I did not try it (not even sure if they had one) but there are plenty of choices outside for restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel In A Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: brabisum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel last week and had an excellent stay. The hotel's location is fantastic, very convenient to the mid-level escalators and just a 5 minute walk to the MTR. The staff was professional, friendly, and courteous. They were always available to answer questions. The lobby is a small area with comfy chairs and free coffee in the morning...it was a great place to meet fellow travelers. Rooms are small, but this is Hong Kong, and that's pretty typical for most small hotels. It's a small price to pay considering the location of the hotel. For single or two person travelers, room size shouldn't be a problem. If I could change one thing, it would be the lack of wi-fi in the rooms. You had to go down to the lobby to access the free wi-fi they have, which was fine, but a tad bit inconvenient. Some previous reviewers noted a smell problem. We didn't notice it. In fact, the hotel interior smelled positively fresh and flowery compared to the marketplace outside. To sum up, for the price this hotel is an excellent value. A fantastic hotel for travelers looking for a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A unique value”
Reviews.Author: akkochi
Reviews.Content: I've been to HongKong many times, even used to live there. So, I know this city and I know what I want there. I found this new hotel might be a good match for me when searching on this TripAdvisor, and it really was. Good: -Decorated with modern-chinese interior. Simple and sophisticated. -Great location! Easy to come from & go to everywhere. From airport, just take Airport Express, which directly arrives at HongKong stn, the nearest stn. Also, convenient to take the subway(MTR) to both HK island side and Kowloon Peninsula side. -Many choices for eating-out. From early morning to late at night, many reasonable local restaurants are available around. -Close to both business / shopping area, which means good for both business traveler / individual sightseeing. -The staff are very helpful and work efficiently, which is quite HongKong-ish I think. -No many group guests are staying. Not good: -In the guest room, bedroom and bathroom is not well divided. It's hard to explain, but, in the superior room I stayed, the bathroom is just a corner divided with glass door. it's very unique and stylish, even use the limited space efficiently at maximum, but still I suppose some will not like it. -Some smell comes out from the drain. I guess because it's surrounded by local shops and restaurant, still again, some will not like it. Well, in HK, you have bunch of choices regarding hotels. I would stay with this hotel if they keep their room rate when they've started, but seems not. (I checked their latest rate on their website, seems a bit higher than when I stayed.) I will try another one next time, but might come back here again depending on their rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great location – Good rate”
Reviews.Author: chikta2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few nights at the Butterfly, in terms of location you can not go wrong. It is in central close to Lang Kwa Fon and a 1 minute walk to the escalators. There is free internet access included in the room which is a nice touch. Unfortunately on our level as you come out of the lift there is a damp smell, I believe there are ongoing works and this didn’t effect our stay. The room and small and cosy But there is little in the way of privacy – the bathroom pane door is almost see through and there is a lack of sound proofing so you can here EVERYTHING when someone uses it. No problems with the service since we didn’t ask for much and spent a lot of time outside of room. We would always have breakfast outside and never spent an evening indoors there This is a perfect location for those wishing to explore at a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem -- and GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: Washingtonian87
Reviews.Content: What a great stay. I was in Hong Kong for a 26-hour layover, and this was a random choice after only an hour of research on TripAdvisor. What an excellent, excellent decision! When I arrived, the greeter whisked my bags away, and showed me to the reception area. The gentleman that checked me in was friendly, helpful, and more than happy to explain all of the evening activities I could enjoy during my brief stay in HK. The room...fantastic. Comfortable beds, spacious and elegant bathroom, rainhead shower...just top notch. Internet is included, and little touches, like slippers and a power converter, really made me feel like I was in a 5-star hotel. The neighborhood is fabulous. A quick walk to the amazing Lan Kwai Fong nightlife district (which puts Cancun to SHAME!), a US$3 cab ride to the Peak Tram (amazing night views), and a nice walk to the botanical gardens and the docks. The concierge / reception staff were so helpful, and helped me pack a lot of activities into a little amount of time. A BIG thank you to the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm small hotel next to Lan Kwai Fong”
Reviews.Author: Halleeboy
Reviews.Content: HK is first stop of my Asia trip. Though it is a small city overall I prefer to stay in somewhere convenient to save my time traveling back to my hotel everyday. This hotel is just 2 blocks away from the famed Lan Kwai Fong area, me and my friends ended up chill out ourselves everynight there in different clubs, which cost us quite some time for sightseeing since we need to hang over a bit each morning. By the way, the hotel itself is excellently designed in some stylish oriental mood, it's exceptionally clean and comfortable. Staffs speak perfect English and helpful. Might come back again when I come to hk again with my family next year

Reviews.Title: “ignorant and poor poor poor”
Reviews.Author: bongkeh
Reviews.Content: whats good about this place? location. else? nothing. room was seriously small, I'm asian and Im fine with it. the restroom, you'll hardly turn around your body. the doorman, doesnt even help with luggage, even one day, i went back shopping a big bag of fabrics, he just dont even bother to help till I told him to help. But he look at me, and shocked, then he asked "all this things?" then I say, yes what do you mean by all this things. the room corridor smells like mold, like a socks with mold. when I was checked in the lady offered us for an upgrade with a double bed, which we refused because im in hong kong with my partner, and celebrating her birthday. Then when I looked at the room size, I emailed the booking manager, I asked him, if may be tomorrow he has a room with a single queen bed in the other upgraded room, if he could upgrade us again, that would be great. But, after 4nights staying, he dont even bother to reply my email. I dont mind if they cant give me any upgrade, but by just send an email saying, "sorry we cant do it" or make an excuse to reply an email thats free, whats the big deal? and I find this very rude by not replying anything. they reply your email very fast when you're booking your room, and none bother to reply when you just ask for a small thing. the housekeeping was seriously lazy, they dont replenish the bath amenities, the complimentary daily water, never clean the cups, and this is happen for everyday. so I need to call them everynight to give me the bath amenities and water, and clean the cups by my self everyday. I dont use the water boiler, it disgusted me, it fills with rice and mold. for all the price I given, and the very lousy service, and the service charge they're charging, they should give me discount for my stay. but too bad, the management was too snobbish, and too busy to reply an email.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Julers
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in a Superior Room at the Butterfly on Wellington whilst travelling from London to Sydney. The hotel is well located very close to the Central–Mid-levels escalator and within 10 minutes walk of the main stations, the Peak Tram and Star Ferry terminal. We arrived at the hotel early but were allowed to check-in. The staff were all polite, spoke very good English and offered help with our bags. The room was of a good size with a compact but well designed bathroom. The only item a little strange was the glass bathroom door, I wonder whether the twin rooms are the same? Good Vietnamese restaurant just down the road where we had an evening meal. Really enjoyed our stay and would most likely choose this (or another Butterfly hotel) if staying in Hong Kong again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location - loved it.”
Reviews.Author: goeastfromhere
Reviews.Content: Initially, when I first checked in, the room was not that great and smelled of smoke, when I had requested non-smoking. However, wonderful response from the staff! I left my bags, because I had an appointment that afternoon and said I would return and see if they had a different room. When I returned, not only was I given a new room, but it was clean, smelled wonderful (non-smoking!) and they upgraded me for no additional cost. The location is ideal for anyone interested in walking to nearby restaurants or cafes, seeing the sites etc. I was here for solo travel, but planned on meeting my student group later, so it was a brief visit. They have wifi in the lobby, wonderful coffee and biscuits in the morning, and an extremely helpful staff. One woman even adjusted my new phone after I could not read the instructions (all in Mandarin). Simply put, they were quite wonderful and I felt a bit sad to leave, as my current accommodations are not as nice. I miss the Butterfly. They were great and the clientele seemed to be urbane and cool. Looking forward to returning another time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lia4
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was good. Very clean, cozy room and perfect location, in the city centre, close to SoHo (nightlife, restaurants etc), peak tram, central station and next to escalator (very important). The only negative is that there is not a breakfast area and no meals are served in the hotel. If you would like to travel to Hong Kong please stay at this area (Hong Kong Island) and avoid Kowloon. Generally, good value for money (140 € per night), if you take into account that hotels in this area are really expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Moment in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: druryperry
Reviews.Content: I spent one lovely night at Butterfly on Wellington, en route between a month in Africa and going home to British Columbia. I was upgraded to a suite which was beautiful, immaculate and comfortable and found my short stay quite perfect in every way - from the doorman who opened the door for me on the street to the ease with which i checked in and out. One comment for visitors - there is no food available in the hotel, no room service, and my mini bar was empty so if you like to get food delivered to your room, you will have to arrange for it. Otherwise there was tea and coffee in the room as well as the usual shower and toiletry amenities. I wished I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “So many great things, but some serious problems”
Reviews.Author: SeeingIsBelieving007
Reviews.Content: We had an extended stay here (about 10 nights) so got to know the place pretty well. One huge problem - an awful sewage stench would sometimes come from the bathroom, particularly after showering. Judging by the other reviewers who have complained of the same thing there are obviously plumbing problems in the building. If it wasn't for that I would have given this place 4 or 5 stars. The location is unbeatable, down a smaller st but walking distance to everything - IFC (including the Airport Express), Soho, LKF, Central Station, etc. Despite it's central location it is very quiet and we slept well. Staff are helpful and courteous, and rooms were decent size by HK standards. Free internet cable in rooms and Wifi at reception. Literally hundreds of restaurants and stores within walking distance. Few other minor things I didn't like, paticularly the bathroom door (a glass sliding door, which provided no privacy between the bathroom and main room. An awful design). Some minor issues with the shower (shower head didn't work properly) and the toilet seat was broken. However the bathroom stench was the only main problem - apart from that I would have recommended this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Jqqls
Reviews.Content: totally acceptable, and with many whistles and bells, but not extraordinary, except for the Nespresso style coffee machine (now if only anywhere in China would actually provide *real* milk). One of those that could do with a good carpet shampoo, but all else was perfectly clean, and all amenities were available. (In room broadband, full range of complimentary toiletries, robes and so on). Immediate locale looked a bit dodgy, (and smelled worse, due to rubbish collection piles) but it's just a few minutes walk to the mid~levels escalator so no need to spend any more time there than necessary. Very secure, so for fellow female travellers, likely a good option, and it's only $HK18.00 from the MRT Airport Express by taxi (and other sights). If they had a restaurant, I never discovered it.... but food places were not far away, including easy access to the SoHo district (by escalator).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money- very clean and new”
Reviews.Author: fussytraveller2
Reviews.Content: Great location and value for money- very clean and new. Just a few doors up from well known noodle/wonton shops, a juice/smoothie bar across the road and very good value for money for a boutique hotel in central Hong Kong. I was in a standard room on the 5th floor and it was spacious (by hk standards) with smart furnishings and a compact but very clean and well designed batrhroom. Noise wasnt a problem. Free wifi in lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Central (i.e. good location), new-ish property”
Reviews.Author: foofighter1981
Reviews.Content: If location is your primary concern, this hotel should be on your short list. It's less than a block away from the mid-levels, meaning it's walking distance to Central / Hong Kong Station / IFC Mall and LKF (which, if you’re a tourist like me, are some key areas)... I'd say around a 6-8 minute walk from the Airport Express (HK) station to the hotel entrance? Granted, the immediate around the hotel seemed a bit dingy, but it never felt unsafe and looked like it was in the first stages of gentrification (for better or worse). Lobby staff was friendly, efficient, and had some particularly great suggestions for eating like a local. The staff working the street-level entrance always took time to say hi and open the doors. The room looked and felt new, if not a bit worn, and was decked out with all kinds of useful gadgets. There was a questionable-looking residue on the tiling under the toilet, which was made to look even more unflattering considering the tiles were black. Cleanliness is a big issue for me, and with this in consideration I give the bathroom a barely passing score. I imagine this property is one of the better choices in the area for the under 1000 HKD price range… but while I would consider staying here again in the future, I'll probably try something else before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: glenclova
Reviews.Content: Booked this place based on recent reviews and ability to get a good deal. Can't beat the location with restaurants, shops and transport all within an easy walk. I had a friendly and efficient welcome when I checked in and found staff helpful at other times. Due to overbooking I had to be assigned a different type of room; seems to be a common problem in HK. Rooms aren't flash but they're adequate. My carpet looked as though it could use a deep clean and there was a strange smell on exiting the lift but fortunately it didn't permeate the room. Wifi in the lobby is a good speed and the computer is useful if you don't have your own. Wifi in the rooms is the next step.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value - peculiar room smell”
Reviews.Author: justlistennowisaid
Reviews.Content: In terms of the location of this hotel in it is hard to imagine it being beaten in Hong Kong, especially for the price, easily walkable from the main station. Slightly off the main roads too so there is no real noise and hustle and bustle to disturb you and this means you can get a decent nights sleep. The price was a reasonable one given the location, the fact that the room was a good size, it was clean and well laid out. The only downside was that there was a slightly odd slightly sewage smell in the bathroom (didn't really permeate into the main room but the bathroom door was closed due to the smell). There is a great little smoothie shop and little restaurant opposite for those wanting to pick up something early morning to eat.

Reviews.Title: “You dont get enough for what you pay!”
Reviews.Author: Ilturco
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel. But I cant really say its a hotel. They dont have any room service, they dont have restaurant, no gym, swimming pool, nothing. All you have nice rooms in a nice location. I wouldnt have a problem with that if the price you pay would reflect with non-existent amenities. Basically I only get a room nothing else, I just think I pay far too much for that, You could stay in lets say Garden View Hotel for half the price, yet you can get a swimming pool and gym etc. If you get a nice deal or promotion, then its ok, otherwise I would not stay here again if I am going to pay more than 200usd a night.

Reviews.Title: “A great location in the Central - shame about the smell”
Reviews.Author: hotsyd22
Reviews.Content: I needed to book a week's accommodation in central and chose the Butterfly on Wellington based on its location and availability for a number of rooms. The location can't be beaten on Wellington street right near the escalators and close to Lan Kwai Fong. The hotel itself is recently renovated but as at May 2011, the renovations still hadn't been completed. The rooms were small (it's HK) but have been 'updated' however not completely - although the bathroom was new, the carpet still looked 20 years old. The biggest drawback for this hotel was the smell. It hits you as soon as you step out of the lift. It is a very strong dank smell which just doesn't leave - fortunately I was not in the room that much but it was pretty bad. My colleague staying on a different floor echoed similar comments about the smell so it isn't confined to one spot! One other small issue was there is no iron in the room and the hotel has no restaurant or room service. This however is a small point given the hundreds of options within walking distance. Overall, it was reasonable for the price

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable, and not too hard on the budget”
Reviews.Author: MerryDevil
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in between Indonesia and Thailand. Hong Kong is not a budget destination by any stretch of the imagination, but the Butterfly is excellent value for money. We booked through Agoda, but shop around online for the best price (including their website), as we found it varied. You can pay a lot more for a lot worse. The rooms are very modern, stylish and clean. The hotel itself seems quite new, with furniture being up to date, and the lounge area in the lobby is a good place to wait for a cab. Internet access is good, the lounge area is very pleasant, and the hotel itself is right in the bustle of Central. The only downside I can think of is the glass doors on our bathroom, which didn't quite close and didn't provide much in the way of privacy. Service is generally helpful, although we did have a hard time getting a cab to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable location if you don't mind a climb, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: alphalau
Reviews.Content: Located in Central on Wellington Street, it is a 10-minute walk from the nightlife district of Lan Kwai Fong. A bit of a climb though on slopes up and down whether from the main road or from LKF, so if you are in your party high heels, it would not be easy. Hotel is small and pleasant enough, but the bathrooms are tiny (cannot fit more than one person at the same time), and the carpet a bit damp and humid. The decor is faux-Chinese style with carved wooden wardrobes. Curtains will have to be drawn all the time as the building opposite is bit 6 meteres or so away. A comfortable, no-frills boutique hotel if you are only looking for a place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Stiil New, but...”
Reviews.Author: Briard8888
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Butterfly On Wellington for 3 nights early April, booked through the group's website which seems to offer the best price and about 10% less than Wotif, for total cost of $HK3000. I consider the hotel offers good value at that price considering the location and that Hong Kong is not a cheap destination. The hotel has only been open for some months, is a slimish purpose built building and still retains a newish feel to it. Having said that there are some issues starting to appear; the room we had minor problems; a blind didn't work, the rainforest shower head wouldn't stay on unless you held the controller in place and there were some quite significant stains to the carpet. not major but I think it is important for the management to work hard to maintain the standard of the hotel, or it could deteriorate quite quickly. Staff were obliging and pleasant generally, they gave us an upgrade from a superior to a deluxe room when my wife asked for a high level room; We found that room to be quite an adequate size although smallish in keeping with most Hong Kong hotels . Rooms have a 20 inch approx LCD and dvd player; complementry broadband and computers for guest use in the first floor reception. We enjoyed our stay and on balance would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and confortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: valery82
Reviews.Content: Very good location, nice and kind staff, beautiful and clean room with a confortable beds...modern structure very very near at the station. i found and i booked this hotel by internet and i haven't any problem.i loved it and i loved hong kong..i hope to came back very very soon!!! i stayed there only 2 nights but it was a great experience. i'm sure that it will be my choise when i came back in hong kong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: GottaTravel13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on TA reviews and we weren't disappointed. After arriving via Airport Express we took a quick taxi to the hotel. It looks like they are currently doing construction on the front of the hotel so you need to take the elevator up 1 floor to the reception desk. The rooms are small in general but very clean and comfortable. The staff spoke a limited amount of english but went out of their way to give us directions and to help us work our cellphones with new SIM cards. The location couldn't be better...easy walking to MTR, alley vendors, D'Aguilar street bars, eateries on Wyndham, etc. Wellington is a mildly hilly street with not much of a sidewalk so I wouldn't recommend it for the elderly or strollers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: woodbridgemom
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a hidded Gem. Clean and Safe, with a most comfortable bed. It is convieniently located. Walk one block to the Mid Level escalators and one can travel all the way to Exchange Square and the Ferry Terminal without ever touching the ground thanks to the elevated pedistrian walkways. SoHo is a block or two up the hill and neighborhood markets are a few steps away. Authentic Hong Kong. We were on the 3rd floor facing the street and dispite the activity in the street, the room was quiet. Tiny restaurant across the street had great food. Very convienient. It we return to Hong Kong, we will stay at the Butterfly.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: paulaEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Butterfly on Wellington is its location. We stayed there for three nights recently and found that we could walk everywhere without having to take public transport at all (apart from the Star Ferries over to Kowloon of course). The "mid levels escalators" are so close that it's easy to get down to the ferry terminals, shopping malls and financial centre and just as easy to get to the bars and restaurants of SoHo and Lan Kwai Fong. Although the street looked a bit dodgy when we first arrived, quite late at night, with a very small entrance to the hotel, we discovered the next morning that it is in the heart of a really bustling, interesting and original part of Hong Kong, and we felt totally safe there. Our double room on the sixth floor was comfortable and not at all noisy, and our bathroom looked fine when we first looked, but on closer inspection we realised it was adapted for disabled use, judging by the safety bars and emergency button by the toilet. While neither my husband nor myself are disabled and hadn't asked for this type of room, I do work with disabled adults so could appreciate that the layout was well thought out. However, because the washbasin was so low (presumably so that it could be used by a disabled person sitting in a wheelchair) my husband ended up having to shave while kneeling on the floor, using a towel as padding for his knees! The washbasin itself was also extremely small, looking nothing like the ones I have seen in the hotel's promotional photos. There were no shelves for our toiletries either, apart from inside the huge shower enclosure, but I think this was also to make maximum space for wheelchair manouevring. I suppose we could have asked if another room was available, but as we had already unpacked following a long flight from New Zealand, all we wanted to do was get to sleep quickly in the very comfortable bed. The staff in the reception area, which is manned 24/7, were very helpful , as was the doorman who found us a taxi at 5.00 am on our last morning. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is no restaurant in the hotel but the room did have tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge, plus a couple of bottles of mineral water. We found a very nice cafe up the road (turn right out of the hotel) called something in Mexican (Cafe del Cielo?) where we had orange juice, coffee and a cinnamon whirl each morning. I would definitely recommend Butterfly on Wellington, mainly for its location, and would go there again if I ever visit Hong Kong, but would try to avoid the disabled room. Good to see that they provided one though!

Reviews.Title: “An authentic Hong Kong experience”
Reviews.Author: vacancestoujour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 6 nights and was upgraded to an executive room on level 20. After only staying in 5 star international chains in Asia, I was apprehensive about making a reservation. However all of my concerns floated away once we saw our large (by HK standards), clean and rather new room. It was decorated in modern chinois, had a large L shaped chaise lounge, comfortable bed, a spacious working desk and a nice bathroom with a rain shower head. We were blown away by its location - the wet market runs along a street next to the hotel, mid levels escalators is less than a 5 minute walk and a few of the recommended restuarants (in michelin guide) are located on the same street. I enjoyed trying the local small eateries, seeing the 'real' markets and walking in the small labyrinths and lanes dotted with market stalls. Soho and Lan Kwai Fong is around the corner which was handy after a late night out. There is a wash & fold service a few doors away and an ironing board and iron are provided by the hotel on request. Another plus was the good variety of satellite tv channels provided by the hotel. I hope the management will continue to maintain the current mint condition of the hotel and not let it run down as I do wish to revisit in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient location, but marred by an odour in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: benign-traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. When we checked in, the experience was great. The reception area, while small, was stylishly decorated in a contemporaneous Oriental theme, and the staff were courteous. While the hotel did not have a restaurant, they did offer nespresso coffee at the reception area, and food was not a problem because there was lots of restaurants and cafes in the area of varying prices. Our room was also excellent, being in the corner and having windows on two sides. The bathroom (which did not include a long bath) was also clean. Unfortunately the bathroom had a pungent odour (which reminded me of sewage and a small dead animal). A call to the reception drew a quick response. A chap from Housekeeping came up and sprayed some anti-bacterial cleaner into the WC. That helped a little. Subsequent feedback to the reception drew an acknowledgment but no further concrete action to resolve the situation. We even suggested that they give us some potpourri to suppress the smell. Given that the rest of the hotel had a pleasant fragrance from potpourri, the absence of a response from the hotel was surprising. In the end we gave up and bought our own air-freshener spray from a shop nearby. So overall, we would say that the experience would have been perfect, if not for the smelly bathroom. We hope that this experience is an aberration. If this problem is a one-off matter, we might consider coming back. But if it were otherwise, then we would not.

Reviews.Title: “My new home in HK”
Reviews.Author: Douglas3
Reviews.Content: I have one more night to go at this little jewel but couldn't wait to write the review. This is a perfect hotel by my standards - clean, comfortable, quietly luxurious, superbly located, and by giving me exactly what I need and none of anything else, it packs an incredible value. This is a small, simple operation. The Butterfly is not a luxury hotel by typical standards - it doesn't have 3 expensive fusion restaurants, or doormen in fancy uniforms, or a line of taxis and Mercedes Benz hotel cars, or a shopping arcade, or even much of a lobby. What it does have is a humble but extremely convenient location on a very local-feeling HK street, wonderful rooms, modern in-room decor and amenities, thoughtful touches, and a fantastic sticker price. The hotel is at the corner of Wellington and Graham streets, on a narrow and pedestrian part of Wellington. While it's not the prettiest block in HK, it feels like the real HK. Graham is just an alley climbing up the hillside, with a street market in full swing, stalls selling vegetables and fish and meats. Wellington has teahouses and retail shops and restaurants that cater more to locals than to tourists. But fear not - it's a block to the Mid-Levels escalators to take you to Soho. A few blocks farther is Lan Kwai Fong and its restaurants and nightlife. There are probably a dozen coffee shops within 3 blocks walk, and restaurants of every price point surround you. And just a few blocks away are Pedder Street and all the luxury boutique shopping you could ever want. I walked here from the Hong Kong Airport Express station via the escalators in about 15 minutes, even with a roller bag. You're even closer to Central MTR station. The Star Ferry is also 15 minutes away via the escalators and a number of very comfortable flyovers. There is a small laundry operation 4 doors down that can wash and fold your laundry for a song. The location is simply divine. Once in your room, you'll find it compact but plenty luxurious. The furnishings are done in a tasteful modern Chinese, with plenty of wood, a sexy bathroom with a rain-style shower (no bath, unfortunately) and vessel-style sink. The decor is very well-done, feeling fresh, clean, modern, and new. The bed is very comfortable, with a nice down blanket, and suffers no shortage of pillows. The TV is a nice flatscreen on a tilting, swinging mount, economizing space but not reducing function. The desk is wide and comfortable, with plenty of room for work and storage. Internet access is wired and plenty fast. In an especially nice touch, the wall outlet is equipped with a foreign plug adapter, so my laptop plugged right in. There's even a DVD player. The climate control is powerful, modern, easy-to-use, and very effective. The only complaints I'd have are small. Rooms do not have irons or ironing boards, a big miss for business travelers. Stylish though the desk chair was, it was not high on comfort. Others have mentioned a slight sewer-y smell in the bathroom - I can confirm this was pretty much ever-present. The toilet was also a little cramped. Lastly, my door never seemed to want to close all the way - probably just needed a little adjustment. I had to make sure I closed it hard whenever I left the room. My room on the 5th floor could be noisy from the street action below, but I did not experience any unpleasantness from neighboring rooms. The elevators aren't great; they're a little slow and not as fashionably done as the rest of the place, but they are secure, requiring keycard access to get to guest floors. Service is minimal. There's a doorman at ground level who has some maps, but he's no concierge. I'm not even sure if most of them spoke English. The lobby is on the next floor up, and while it looks presentable and has 2 public iMacs for free use, it's thinly staffed, and besides checking people in and out I'm not sure they had much to do. I did get help printing a few documents, but I did not get offered help with my bag (not that I would have accepted). Now for the best part - I got all this for less than $160 USD per night, all-in. It was an outstanding value. I travel to HK several times per year, usually for about a week at a time, and I've traditionally stayed at another, much larger, much more full-service hotel. I've given that hotel good reviews, but their price crept up and up and up to the point where I needed to try something new. I'm so glad I did. If you don't need all the glitz and shine, but still want comfortable, clean, luxurious appointments in more of a serviced apartment vein, and need a great location, I don't know why you'd even consider anything else, especially considering the price. The Butterfly is my new home in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - but had some issues on my second stay”
Reviews.Author: JDfromUSA
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel for many reasons - central location, reasonable rates, attentive staff and newer construction. But during my recent stay I dealt with a couple issues 1) the room (on 26th floor) was musty and no amount of A/C removed the humidity. I realize this is common in HK and difficult to mitigate. 2) the bathroom had a sewage/septic odor (as also mentioned by another reviewer). I tried to identify the source but was unsuccessful so I switched rooms. The second room (on 23rd floor) was not musty and the sewage odor not present --- well, not at first, but during my stay I did notice a slight odor. I am not sure I would stay at BOW again based on my experience and the fact another reviewer had a similar issue. I am hoping that management will identify and fix these issues because I really like the hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Centre Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: appywanderers
Reviews.Content: 100 paces to promenade walk that connects with hill escalator. Fifteen minute walk using promenade escalator and elevator system to Airport Express @ Hong Kong Station. This was easy walk each carrying a carryon bag and pulling a roller suitcase. Built or fully refurbished last year, 24 stories. Slight sewage smell in bathroom that was only noticeable in morning of checkout. Rooms large by HK standards. Thin walls do allow some noise to pass through, heard conversation after midnight each night. Require 600 Hong Kong dollar deposit on checkin. Pay in cash and avoid any delay in refund to credit card. Cash was returned @ 5 am checkout without issue. Ethernet cable provided and free wifi in lobby area. No breakfast or food services but good juice bar right across street. Enjoy pre dinner drink @ Mingle Bar 50 paces down the street offering inside and outside seating nice modern jazz music. Also Dim Sum @ Lin Heung 100 paces down Wellington available from 6 am to 4 pm then normal cantonese dinner entres until 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very New and High Quality Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfacets
Reviews.Content: For this first trip to Hong Kong, I studied TripAdvisor and all else available to select a hotel. This hotel is a delightful little boutique hotel placed right in the middle of Central Hong Kong. The staff is courteous and helpful, but as I have found throughout Hong Kong, aren't especially good at English. The staff did make every effort to help me and ensure I had a pleasant stay. What is especially noteworthy about this hotel is the quality of the rooms, and the overall pleasant ambiance. While the rooms are rather compact, they have very nice functionality, with a big flat screen tv, good solid bed, light-shielding curtains, and wonderful bathrooms in with earthenware sinks and fancy fittings. I suspect that this hotel's equipment is every bit as nice as many of the much more expensive "premier" Hong Kong hotels. Since there are only four/five rooms per floor, this hotel is especially quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel. Great Location. Worth Staying here”
Reviews.Author: TiestoFan242
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Hong Kong Central. Its about a 15 min walk or 5 min cab ride from Airport express tram center in Central. from Airport is only a 22 min ride. Its about $100 to $150 HK dollars each way and you get a discount fare if you are with someone and buy two tickets together. Hotel situated on Wellington which is quiet street at night but within 5 min walk to a great 24 hr restaurant that has great reasonable price food. While walking down wellington street it really give you a feel for Honk kong. There are two restaurants, one across from hotel and the other about 25 yards to rt of hotel if you exit front door. They have great breakfast, Ham and egg sanwhiches on bun for like HK$30. Well worth a visit. The hop on Hop off bus is located by airport exress tram terminal, and for the price is a great deal. Both busses takes you all over the city, gives great opportunities for pictures, and can travel on both buses in about 2 hrs if dont get off but to switch buses at the harbor. Great place for burgers while waiting on next buss is at place called Burger Box, It located next to ferries. Back to Hotel. Great location, 5 min walk to nightlife in Soho, and rooms are super cleam, comfortable, flatscreen tv, and Shower has a rainfall shower head hanging from the ceiling. Staff very helpful. I deff will stay here again on my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dezign99
Reviews.Content: A new hotel. Rooms small but comfortable. No breakfast but many eateries in the vicinity. I would visit again. The only downside is that I amn battling to find an e-mail address for the hotel. The hotel is still holding on to my visa debit card guarantee even if I left the hotel more than 1 month ago. There are no funds outstanding which I owe to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel in the heart of Central, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: VinceChoo
Reviews.Content: With a need for a convenient location to walk from, WiFi and comfort, we selected Butterfly on Wellington Street, Hong Kong for all the above. Why a boutique hotel? Our preference for a smaller, more select clientele, faster checking in and out, more personalized service (if required) and usually less "worn out" rooms. Fortunately this hotel recently opened its doors a few months back so everything was very new and that was a big plus in our filter. There isn't much of a front entrance/lobby so make sure you print out the map and address. Taxis are very efficient from the Airport Express Link to the city and know their way around (but of course!). While it is possible to walk from the train station I didn't fancy lugging my suitcases around past midnight and unfamiliar with my surroundings. The hotel's fast and efficient check in staff made sure that we were comfortably settled into our room after a late night check in. There are large windows but not much of a view from where we stayed, the view is blocked by many sky scrapers that dot the city. Everything that was supposed to work, worked from the (branded) capsule coffee machine, TV, high pressure shower cubicle, firm mattress. I know many people enjoy soft pillows but I'm not one of them, preferring a firm, foam pillow. Fortunately it didn't affect my sleep. If you are a foodie, Wellington Street boasts many well known eateries from end to end including the 24 hour Tsui Wah toward the Lan Kwai Fong pub area. There are lots of well known restaurants but make it a habit to call ahead of lunch and dinner to avoid a 30-45 minute wait. There isn't a restaurant or cafe in the hotel. They do serve tea and coffee at tea-time at the reception but with the amount of cafes and restaurants all within a few minutes' walk, it would be pointless. Hong Kong is very safe and I didn't feel any danger so I would place it at par with Singapore. I enjoyed my stay at Butterfly on Wellington and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything”
Reviews.Author: JFH1107
Reviews.Content: Step out the door of this hotel and your in the midst of Hong Kong street life, including a great daily market right on the corner. There are dozens of interesting shops and restaurants throughout the neighborhood (Soho/Lan Kwai Fong/Central) catering to both locals and tourists. Our room was the Executive, the largest size available. It would compare to a standard size room in a US hotel, so I imagine standard rooms here are truly tiny. But it was comfortable and surprisingly quiet too. The bed was very very hard - you'll either like that...or not... If you want the convenience of an onsite restaurant, pool or fitness center - or if you have trouble walking up and down hills and stairs - this might not be the best choice of hotel for you. I loved it and will definitely stay there again when I return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff, cool interior design”
Reviews.Author: jamestam30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a total of 4 days in January to sight see around hong kong. The location is right in the middle of central, allowing good access to the piers and also to the restaurants and bars of soho. The room we stayed in allowed excellent sleep - room 302. However we had initially been given a free upgrade to an executive room which we stayed in for 1 night only as outside this the air conditioning vents provide a constant background hum. I am a light sleeper so we opted for one on a floor away from the air conditioning. YOu can just hear the cars outside but you are in the central busiest part of hk & we slept well here. There is no restaurant hence no breakfast option which is fine cos there are so many places outside the hotel within 100m that provide food. Overall a very good stay. Would probably stay again if we go back to hk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fernandez124
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by smiling, helpful, English speaking staff who took us to our room. The room we were given was spacious, clean with a massive bed and huge shower. Internet access was free, The location was excellent, it was about a 5 min walk from the train station, close to bars, shops, restaurants and the escalators to go up to the peak. If I was going back to Hong Kong I would without doubt stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: tripperi
Reviews.Content: Right on the spot near Soho and shopping in Central. Professional staff, modern and nice rooms, roomy by HK standards. Not very many breakfast options nearby, but loads of choice for lunch and dinner. Only 3 rooms /floor, so not much noise from fellow travellers coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Lissyandlancer
Reviews.Content: Good little hotel in the soho area. Its not a big luxury hotel but we didn't want to pay big prices as we planned to sight see most of the day. It is clean and close to central station, IFC, and Landmark. The rooms are a bit small but manageable. We walked from central station to hotel in about 10 min after getting airport express. Use mid level escalator. It is close to all the resturants and cafe, especially Whydem street. The flying pan is close by cafe to grab breakfast in the morning. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Want to Capture the Essence of HK?”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel for prime HK exposure -- and at a great rate. It offers a very personable, professional staff; well-maintained rooms and common areas; free internet; and they say complimentary access to some of the city's establishments (from what I remember), though that was not something I was made aware of until I completed the guest survey. HK is jam-packed and you're in the center of it all! Some come to embrace this for so much culture, great shopping, ease of access or necessity (business, etc.), and others are UNpleasantly surprised by how much a commodity space and quietness is in this city; if the latter is the case refer to my review for Le Meridien Cyberport. WHAT YOU REALLY NEED TO KNOW: The hotel is a bit hard to locate -- even for cab drivers -- so I HIGHLY RECOMMEND that you bring the hotel's name, address and phone number (preferably ALSO written in Chinese), a map along with street intersections and two or so landmarks. The hotel's façade and entryway is quite low-key. You'll see a guard/greeter in the entryway, then proceed to the second floor. My experience: Upon arrival, I was a bit a little apprehensive that even a resident cab driven didn't know where this hotel was (which is actually part of what makes Butterfly on Wellington so great; you are SO ENTRENCHED in the city, and HK has so many small streets with a lot of establishments on them). I was warmly greeted and it almost seemed like reception was expecting me at that exact moment. I was seated and offered a beverage while everything was processed. My room...well, it's HK, so do NOT expect a lot of space unless your favorite hobby is spending. Everything was in order, so I was a happy camper. In comparison to my last stay in HK at Le Meridien where it is isolated and very quiet, I was expecting a loud night and a hard time sleeping. It was actually very quiet. Don't count on a view. Well, count on a genuine HK view...lol...one with lots of buildings in close proximity. That aside, the hotel's location is GREAT! I felt like most things were within walkable distance. I also loved the fact that you don't feel like you're on tourist island, kept away from the "real" side of the city. With Butterfly on Wellington, I felt immersed in residential/domestic everyday life. The hotel also offers free internet and there are computers located in the lobby for guests to use at their convenience. Tips: DEFINITELY take Peak Tram, the cable car close to the zoological and botanical gardens, in the evening hours. Also, reception (from what I remember) advises that breakfast is served in the morning. While I was there, all they offered was coffee, I think some juice and small biscuit cookies w/ a local newspaper. If you need any sort of toiletry, tylenol, drinks or snacks at any hour, make a right outside the hotel, walk up a block and make a left. You should see a 7-Eleven and another convenience store across the street....a lot of people arrive at the hotel late at night, and if you want to keep on a budget, it's useful.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive week of bad sleep”
Reviews.Author: CCWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel showed so much promise, but has ended up being one of the worst hotels I've ever experienced in Hong Kong. As an ex-pat who has lived in Hong Kong and stayed in many hotels in HK on trips, I have something to compare to. Pros: To be fair the staff are generally lovely with a few grumpy exceptions, and they do try to do their best to give you what you want. The location can't be beaten, and the decor does look lovely when you first walk into your room. Here is where it ends. Cons: 1. Smoked out non-smoking rooms. Our non-smoking room on level 17 smelled like a smoker’s apartment, and was two single beds despite booking a double, and we had to stay in that room first night because the hotel was fully booked and it was all they had. Moved the next day to another non-smoking room on level 12 less smoky, but you could still get a whiff of smoke from time to time. Clothes not yet worn that remained in my tightly Zipped up suitcase reeked of smoke from that first room. 2. Noisy, hence very bad sleep. Water gurgles in pipes all night, you can hear somebody cough in the next room, the housekeeping staff start at 7 am and bang their access door about 50 times loudly, which sounds like it's right in your room. 3. Beds. Despite booking and paying for a double bed we ended up with a two single beds, nearly fell out a couple of times, haven't had to sleep in single bed since I was about 16 years old! Pillows were rubbish, flatten out into a pancake like thickness. even two together were terrible. 4. Bathroom. Water pressure is really bad in this building. In the room in level 17 we could hardly get it to flush. The rest of our stay on level 12 the hot water oscillated between scalding and chilly on a cycle of 30 seconds each on rotation. The water pressure went up and down accordingly. Having a shower was really not fun at all and took longer as you hopped around in the shower to avoid getting burnt and frozen. Overall: this hotel is young and is already wearing very badly. The baby poo brown carpet although only a few months old already looks like 30 years old. The housekeeping noise is fixable, but the rest of it is a real problem. I wasn't happy paying just under $300 Australian dollars per night to be woken up multiple times and get tortured in the shower. Left my room each morning exhausted and in a bad mood. I will NEVER stay here AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: BathOntheroadagain
Reviews.Content: A little gem in an otherwise expensive city for accommodation. Takes a little bit of finding,but worth the effort...if in doubt take a taxi,but I walked from the train station at Central after taking the airport express. Good security-lift was attended all the time and you can only access hotel floors with a room key fob. Rooms were comfortable although quite small. Great bed and shower area. Staff were very helpful and internet access throughout. A nice treat at the end of a long trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fisher_traveler0416
Reviews.Content: Going to the lobby, receptionist was very friendly. Went up to the room, size was excellent, got upgraded to their wellington executive room. Check out was flawless, I didn’t have to wait, only took about 2 minutes. Only downside, there are not a lot of taxis outside. But I would still give this hotel a five star, excellent hotel, recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monchhichilover
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a few days in late November. The hotel is in perfect location. Staff are always friendly and provide excellent service. Even hotel does not provide breakfast, don't worry about this. You can find lots of restaurant nearby. I stayed in deluxe room. The room is clean and comfortable. I will definitely come back to Butterfly on Wellington! How can you miss the chance to stay in a brand new hotel with good value of money??

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, busy location.”
Reviews.Author: Sheesha1812
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those who are there to party in LKF as it is less than 10 minutes to walk to. We took a taxi from the "Hong Kong Station at the Airport Express" and it took us a really long time to get to our hotel due to the traffic in the area. My sister and I found it very convenient to get to LKF and back but in the afternoons it is an extremely busy area and it is generally quite difficulty to get a taxi around there. The room itself was nicely done, modern finishings and very clean. Overall we do not have any complains about the rooms and staff but we probably will not stay there again because of the location of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Review of room with disabled access”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowtraveller
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 12 days Pros: efficient service from answering of emails (re queries before i had actually booked up) through to checking out. Friendly and helpful concierge. Great location as surrounded by eateries for all budgets (but see downside later). Our room was on 6th floor facing back and although wellington street is busy we were not disturbed by noise and got restful sleep. For me ( in a relatively compact manual wheelchair) the disabled access room was very satisfactory in term of size, layout and amenities. However hotel would not provide a chair for the shower area. i purchased one and have suggested they make this small investment. bed firmness fine for me (I'm prone to backache and therefore quite fussy about beds!) Cons: location wise the street is on a hill, luckily my b/f is fit and strong and was able to push me around. Some of the surrounding streets are quite steep and/or have steps so you need to do a reccy and work out best route for you...but that's part of the challenge/fun of travelling. Overall i thought the room rate was good value. Services provided by hotel minimal (eg. no restaurant, no gym/pool) but we didn't need those. Would definitely come back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelInsider
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely modern hotel with excellent/comfortable furniture and fittings in a moderately spacious room, and very centrally located on Hong Kong Island. Free fast internet was a nice bonus. Note - I took a taxi from the Airport train terminal. I told the driver where I wanted to go, and showed him the name/address of the hotel. He indicated his understanding, and off we went. Fortunately I was following our route in the GPS, and after several miles in the opposite direction, it turned out he was going to a different Butterfly hotel. Make sure you go to the correct Butterfly hotel (very close to the station).

Reviews.Title: “The hidden gem of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PixiBrighton_UK
Reviews.Content: Sadly we only got to stay at this lovely hotel for one night. It is a small boutique hotel in central Hongkong - very close to the lovely Soho area for art, bars and great restaurants. The rooms are really beautifully decorated and very practical. Beds are comfy. Good storage space. Staff are friendly and helpful. Bathrooms are very modern and clean however not brilliantly designed - but we could live with that. The only other downside is that if you are leaving early in the morning that street is very quiet so not many taxis - you may have to walk up to one of the main streets with your suitcases - and it is VERY hilly and steep around there. But if you can - stay here it is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ELKINCHRISTOPHEALAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week. Amazing experience. The staff work effeciently and always friendly. What an amazing service they run! I'd come back Hongkong and stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Butterfly - heartily recommend”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugs_Two
Reviews.Content: This is the newly opened Butterfly hotel, being open about one month. It’s a boutique hotel so small and intimate. We were warmly greeted, efficient & seemless check in. We had a Superior room which was lovely and beautifully decorated making it a restful environment to come back to each day. Staff couldn’t be more attentive or helpful and went out of their way to look after their guests. They don't have a restaurant but there is a relaxing area in reception where coffee is on offer each morning, a morning paper for those who want one. and internet facilities. The bed was firm but that is normal in HK hotels. Lovely quiet room with beautiful bathroom and generously stocked. The huge point of value, the room had generous storage for luggage, clothing, the fridge wasn't cluttered with a minibar, but for those wanting a drink there was no shortage of outlets close by where one could buy anything they wanted. We felt well looked after and our custom valued. We’d definitely stay there again and are happy to recommend. Lovely location - walking distance to public transport. Don't forget your Octopus card. Fruit and vegetable stalls very close by and market stalls down most side streets that lead to the main roads. Prebooking and payment made the entire process hassle free. We heartily recommend this lovely hotel. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Central, HK”
Reviews.Author: TerrySingapore
Reviews.Content: Took a punt and stayed here for 3 nights. It was excellent. A fantastic location, a brand new hotel, and at a great price. Small rooms, but you get that in HK. I hope that they don't put up the room rate, as this provides real value for money in an otherwise expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, ticks all the boxes.”
Reviews.Author: pulford
Reviews.Content: The customer service from the staff was top quality and genuine. The rooms were great value and the location is perfect. Modern décor and finished to a high standard. Would definitely stay here again! Plenty of great restaurents near by, really recommend Classified, The Cheese Room for breakfast if you aren't ready to sample fish dumping's or chicken feet just yet. 5 mins walk away on 108 Holywood Road. It has only been open a month but word is getting around, they are already full for our next visit :(.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samcitycat
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 night stay at the Butterfly on Wellington, Pros: Great location, just a few minutes walk to great restaurants, public transportation, shopping, and tourist attractions. We were upgraded to the Executive Suite which was spacious and had good views. Rooms were clean, comfortable (with one exception, below). Nice bathrooms. Cons: Beds went beyond "firm", a bit uncomfortable for we Americans who are used to a softer mattress. Coffee in the AM left a bit to be desired. If the rates don't go up significantly, I'd definitely suggest this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Central, a real gem”
Reviews.Author: JohnHongKong
Reviews.Content: Butterfly on Wellington is a little gem, just opened a few weeks ago in Central. Great location in fact, although some will definitely not like the narrow, busy street it is on. Two minutes walk to mid-levels escalator or QRC, a few minutes to SoHo. Rooms fine - clean, nice double bed (tad small if you are tall and with a spouse/friend), 4 great pillows, flat screen TV, DVD, free internet (excellent, very fast) with cable provided, nice bathroom, great shower, (empty fridge though!)., (2 very nice, large fluffy towels! miles better than Bishop Lei!)...all in all, fantastic for a solo traveller. I loved it, and I have stayed in top 5-star hotels all over the world. I think they are offering promotional rates at the moment, as their brochure talks about room rates of about HK$2,100 upwards - I paid much less. Why pay HK$3,000 - HK$5,000+ per night for some fancy hotel , if its coming out of your own pocket? Utter madness!!! If they keep their prices down I will definitely stay again.
